Building a champion 🏆  - post 2 out of X

--

When you send your champion to sell internally, force them to talk about THE PAIN FIRST.

No one likes going into a room of strong stakeholders and start talking to them about a product they never heard of.. and have them consider spending on it…

The same as you talk to your buyer about their pains before talking about your “Amazing product”, have them do the same with their team to get them on board.

Remember - You own the sale.
You own the process.
Help your champion by TEACHING them how to sell.

Gotta love “Employee Appreciation Day”!!
😍

Building a champion 🏆  - post 1 out of X

--

We often talk to a lead who likes our product and offering and send them their way to sell it internally as our champion.

We even ask - "who will be the DM for this?"
"What other stakeholders do we need to get to the table?"

What we tend to forget is checking -
What are THOSE DMs' top priorities right now?
What are the COMPANY’S top priorities?

The answer to these questions highly affects the messaging and the value you and your champion need to have for that internal selling.

Remember - you own the sale.
You own the process.
You need to LEAD the way to closed-won.

Ask yourself this question every day:

Is what I’m doing now moving me towards or away from my goals?

There is no neutral.

There’s this quote that says, “Even if you’re on the right track, you’ll get run over if you don’t move.”

Since success is an upward climb, sitting still means you’re moving backwards.

If you ask yourself this question 3-5 times a day, the BS and excuses will start to fade.

This doesn’t mean you can’t ever relax or hang out with friends.

All of those align with personal goals, which are just as important as professional ones.

But does spending an hour on TikTok move you towards any of your goals?

Maybe.

But if not, you’re moving further away from your goal.

One of my most important goals is to be a passionate and playful dad.

I ask myself: Is what I’m doing now bringing me closer to that?

If the answer is no, I adjust my behavior.

Without frequent check-ins with yourself, it’s easy to get off track.

Write the question on a sticky note and put it somewhere you’ll see it throughout the day. 

I guarantee asking that question will make a huge difference in your life.

What’s something you did today that moved you closer to your goal?

It's that time of the week again, today we spoke to Yaara Tirosh who is leading the recruitment process within our sales team. Quick reminder --> within our sales team most members have additional responsibilities that help the entire department progress and move forward.

‏⭐️How does it feel to receive extra responsibility at such an early stage at Connecteam ?
Feels amazing. It’s a great pat on the back to be trusted with such a big responsibility within my first year. The constant growth here and progression keeps me super motivated and excited!

‏
⭐️So what exactly is your new role within the sales team?
I’m in charge of the department recruiting, meeting the strategic needs, the recruitment process itself, preparing the department and maintaining great experiences for the interviewees.

‏
⭐️What does your daily routine look like?
The mornings are usually the ultimate time to work on projects to do with my department roles, plenty of meetings, mingles and catch ups. The afternoons and evenings are dedicated to clients, sales, and fun!

‏
⭐️Do you feel you have a big impact on the department?
Absolutely!
It’s incredible how big of an impact I have here. I would say that on top of the feeling, it’s required from us to bring our opinions and change the processes here according to our understanding. My voice has never been so important!

Managing our learning and development

Leading our on-boarding process

Outbound is broken, but don't give up on it yet.

#Outbound sales usually take more effort than inbound, but it had proved to bring in better leads and deals.💲💲

How is it done today?

How many of us get LinkedIn connection requests from people we don't know?

Many times, these are selling attempts from salespeople who gave up on cold calls and emails due to the effort it takes and the low response rates.

Potato Potahto! It's the same thing guys!
Reaching out on LinkedIn is still cold!

Why should someone who doesn't know you (or your business) care?

In #outbound - salespeople got to be creative.👨‍🎨

Warm up the lead by reacting to his activity...
Find someone both you and your lead know who could make an introduction...

Work Smarter - Not Harder. ✌

How do you do outbound?
Do salespeople sometimes cross the line from being active to aggressive?

We all have the desire to speed-up growth, so sometimes we tend to forget to look under the hood and understand if we are ready to scale and what would be the best way.

This talk is a must.

Thank you Mark Roberge

If it worked for you once - It means NOTHING.

In day to day life, it's normal to remember actions we did that led to positive outcomes.
We were raised to remember those moments for future circumstances.

But when it comes to growth initiatives, it could be that cold emails or promotions worked for you in your last company. Maybe doing tons of FB marketing and getting inbound leads. 

This doesn't mean it's going to work this time. 

The important things to keep in mind are:

1 - Try, try, and again - try different methods, until you find what's working best for you this time. 

2 - Make sure you have the right tools to measure what you're trying. 

3 - Always test new things, think of new ideas and use different tools. Your audience might find it refreshing seeing you where others are not present.

4 - Test in a fast and minimal way before you scale, so if you fail - you fail fast and go on.


Always Be Trying and Testing.

#growth #newthings #scale

what‘s the creepiest thing you ever did?

Scott Galloway coined the phrase “In marketing, creepy is relevant.” Location targeting probably takes the lead in this equation, as even a giant like Sir Martin Sorrell calls it the “Holy grail of marketing.” That is because, when done right, location targeting is one of the core pillars in reaching that elusive “right ad, right person, right place, right time.” 

So why isn’t this happening already? Smartphones have been around for about a decade or so, and it is known that they now hold more computing power than the computer used to put a man on the moon. And if they can land a man on the moon, how come they're not making the best out of me going to the mall? 

But location targeting is not just pushing a coupon when you’re close to a store. It’s connecting your online availability (“anywhere, anytime” - one of the most repeated app taglines of our days) with your offline experiences. Working from home or spending 14 hours a day in the office? Are you a vegan? Are you at the movies every time a new Marvel movie is out?

For this to happen, we need to embrace the full potential of data. And we need to form the habit of validating our results, to ensure we’re not just adding to the noise. 

Sounds creepy? I dare you to just sit and wait.

The Ad Tech industry has a lot to learn from the Kardashians.

84% of marketers will open at least one influencer campaign in 2017, and 81% say it's expensive but worthwhile. The big question for ad tech is - Is there a way to influence without influencers?

1. Credibility - People want to trust the messages they see. Constant skepticism is a nightmare, but on the other hand, so is dealing with intrusive ads that only care about what the advertiser wants to say. An ad is a dialogue with real people-make sure the format matches its placement and that it looks & feels as native as can be.

2. People See, People Do - People want to know that when they click on your ad, they are doing so because real people did it before them and got real value - think of Amazon reviews or just a screenshot of a great AppStore feedback. It's not Drake, but real people have a better chance at influencing others- better than any slick copy.

3. Create Your “Clique” - Everybody knows there’s a difference between using Dylan or Bieber as influencers. They represent different “cliques” in a way that goes deeper than just demographic targeting. Have you ever connected your creative to a specific clique? Pro Tip, Think of the presenter you’ll choose for it in an ideal world and reverse engineer it .

Shani Fine Itamar Benedy Christina Toal Bryce Wagshul

The internet will soon stop being free. 

Our only line of defense against it is the ad tech industry, as monetization solutions that are based on ads are the only ones that keep the internet free of charge. We are the people on the wall, and we see those monthly charges for using Google or Facebook coming towards us like the white walkers. What makes them pick up the pace? The install rate of ad blockers. What do you think will happen when 80-90% of users will use it? (Netflix and Spotify charging a fee and Forbes blocking ad blockers are just the beginning). 

But it’s not the people’s fault. We, the ad tech industry, forgot about the real people that engage with these ads. We got too comfortable, acting as a middleman between the advertiser and the publisher, that we only thought of people as numbers in our reports.

We are feeding those white walkers, as their soldiers are real people with ad blockers. How do we change that? We focus on the real people, and how to provide them with actual value. We actively seek new ways to engage with people who see our ads, and we make sure that we keep their interest at heart while doing so. 

More on new ways to engage with people in ways that will get them to love your brand  - coming soon...

Your audience is not your enemy. You don’t need to look for ways to outsmart it, just like they don’t need to look for the means to block you. So why do they? Mainly because you treat them as targets, and not as people. 

Ad blockers install rate saw a 30% increase in 2016. During the same year, over 100 million people took the time to watch this ad (https://lnkd.in/gJh7jQq) on YouTube. How can these two statistics coexist? When you think of your audience as people, and provide them with added value they would enjoy consuming, not only will they not block you - they will actively spend time searching for your ad and sharing it.

What’s next? Don’t try to fight ad blockers. Instead, invest in fighting bad ads.  That means that accurate targeting that will make it feel more like a content recommendation, and making your ads look and feel more like a native part of the app should be key. You will be amazed to see the type of growth that comes from partnering with your audience instead of going against it.

80% of ad tech companies won't survive the next two years. Once upon a time, ad-tech start-ups saw profits fast. These times are now gone, so if you’re looking for a quick buck, you’re in for some serious disappointment. Want to avoid this statistic? Here are a few points to consider:

1/ Care for the end user - The most important thing is the user experience. Yes, he’s not your direct client. No, there’s nothing that matters more - not in the long run.

2/ Find your niche - Don’t spread yourself too thin. This is not Pokèmon Go, trying to catch them all won’t get you extra points. As for ad tech (and many other industries) the winner takes all, so be laser focused on what you do best.

3/ Be the expert- Your product is the value you provide, but clients today are looking for much more than that. Be the one who knows. Stay on top of current trends, share valuable and actionable tips. 

4/ Enjoy the process - You're in ad tech, not in curing cancer. If you don't enjoy what you do, why the hell do you keep doing it? 

5/ Just like show business has show AND business in it, ad tech has advertising AND tech in it. You can't have an ad tech business without the tech, just like you can't succeed at show business just by showing up.

To help those of you who can and will travel this summer, we interviewed the #CyberSecurity expert, who also happens to be our skilled Cyber Researcher, Emmanuel Ouanounou.

🔒 What are the cybersecurity risks for those who travel abroad?

"I think that the main vulnerability is connecting to public Wifi networks."

🔒 Why is that so dangerous?

"Because when you're connected to a public network, even a mediocre hacker can see everything you send and receive.  In other words, they can see your messages, passwords, and personal data."

🔒 So, what's the solution?

"I suggest using a VPN and visting https encrypted sites. These technologies make sure your communication is encrypted and help you sleep better😊. And don't worry. You can easily download a VPN app."

🔒 If we're already having this conversation, tell us an interesting cybersecurity story.

"I once took part in a data science hackathon. Because I'm better at cybersecurity than in data science, I used my cyber skills, hacked the network, and stole the other team's solutions. Needless to say, my team won. OK, both of our teams won."

Thanks for the helpful explanation and the funny story, Emmanuel!

There's no doubt we're a bit smarter now. 😊

A plea to marketers - don't outsource YOUR writing to AI

Let me explain

In an AI world, everything starts to look the same. We have more of everything because it's much easier to create - software, content, video, images, etc.

Using AI for all those things makes sense.

But not for YOUR writing. 

Writing is a foundational skill all marketers should possess, even if you never publish content for an external audience.

Writing helps you with two critical skills:

- Thinking clearly
- Explaining simply

Bill Gates has described writing as a way to sit down and re-evaluate his thoughts during the day. 

I started writing to take my jumbled-up thoughts and organize them logically so I could think more clearly about problems.

But, more importantly, writing helps you take a complex thing and explain it in simple terms. 

Einstein said, "If you can't explain something simply, you don't understand it well enough."

When interviewing people, I always look for this. Can you explain your role and your successes with clarity of thought and in simple terms?

William Wheeler famously said, "Good writing is clear thinking made visible."

As more of our roles become automated, thinking clearly, explaining simply, and being able to communicate, those things will grow, not shrink in importance. Communicate to customers, to colleagues, to our CEO.

Always remember to automate some tasks and focus on becoming 10X in others. For marketers, writing is one of those 10X skills.

I’m thrilled to share that I have received the Dean’s List Award for academic achievement in my first year of studies 🎓

TLDR: I led my first ever webinar during a military operation 

Last week, I led my first ever webinar, with over 130 participants. While that alone is nerve wracking, the fact that it was in the middle of an operation didn’t make it any easier. What would I tell clients if I had to evacuate in the middle?

The webinar was the first of its kind, I was honored to be the first ever “Supporter” leading a webinar, where we addressed common questions asked in the chat. It was my first time being able to engage with our clients face to face and, while challenging, it was an insightful experience.

Luckily, the webinar went siren-free, and hopefully I’ll never have to think about that “what if” ever again. It’s part of the reality that those living in Israel unfortunately have to face.
Thank you to Lee Etzion  Adva Deuitch  Shoshana Fleischmann  for the support throughout the process. 

To many more (siren-free) webinars! 

Pictured: Showing clients that were a 100% live assistance team!

#STANDWITHISRAEL

I have been in Israel for almost a year and during this time it has become my home. When I read the news and realize the horror to which the Jewish people are subjected, I clearly understand that the Holocaust is not what happened several generations ago, but what is happening now. 
Hundreds of abducted and murdered young people raped women during the celebration of freedom and independence. Burnt babies, old people dragged to Gaza who passed the Holocaust as trophies, 1,300 dead and 3,000 wounded. The biggest loss of civilian life since the Holocaust. 
Here is a small part of the horror that is happening right now in Israel. 

"Israel is an occupier," people from Russia tell me. Read the Bible guys, read the etymology of the word Jerusalem, and look at the root of history. At the beginning of time, you will not have any questions about the state of Israel being here. 

Israel is not attacking, but defending itself. All we see now is a response to the horror and terror of the last days. The answer to the terrorists can only be this because they understand nothing but the language of force. This is especially true of the leftists, who shout about the constant bombing of Gaza. 

Israel has always supported Gaza. Supplied her with drinking water and electricity. Issued quotas for work. He wanted peace.  I was looking for ways to compromise.
What the Arab world was doing was buying off this place, sending money ostensibly to humanitarian aid, but HAMAS terrorists were at the head of Gaza. Helping them with money is like supplying them with missiles. How can you support a government that makes the destruction of another state the goal of its state?
And where are all those who support Gaza now? Where are you Arabs? Where are your ships that take refugees from there? Instead, Egypt closes its only checkpoint and people are locked up. Unfortunately, people have turned into animals over hundreds of years of propaganda and violent power. 

Israel will get out of this mess and become even stronger, but anti-Semitic sentiments will not be over. The world will still be screaming about ambiguity. That it's not that simple. And to wash away the boundary between good and evil. 
It's very convenient to talk when you're in a warm bed far from the war. Your mind becomes much cleaner when you see hundreds of rockets, hear the sounds of an air raid, and realize how valuable your life is at these moments.

But if there’s one thing that defines us, it’s our spirit. It’s the Israeli way to face hard times with courage and to see beyond them. Our innovation doesn't pause, it's our path forward, our way to make things better.

We're stepping forward, not alone, but together, carrying the legacy of Israeli resilience and ingenuity into the future.

𝐆𝐨𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐮𝐩𝐦𝐚𝐫𝐤𝐞𝐭 𝐢𝐬 𝐝𝐢𝐟𝐟𝐢𝐜𝐮𝐥𝐭. 𝐆𝐨𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐝𝐨𝐰𝐧𝐦𝐚𝐫𝐤𝐞𝐭 𝐢𝐬 𝐢𝐦𝐩𝐨𝐬𝐬𝐢𝐛𝐥𝐞.

My advice to most emerging software companies is start by selling to SMBs and then move upmarket. Why? Competition is weaker at the low-end of the market, barriers to entry are lower, and you can play around with pricing and marketing strategies as you start to build a sustainable customer base.

Moreover, shorter sales cycles offer better opportunities to learn and grow, and you won’t get stuck in months-long procurement, legal and regulatory processes that could pose an existential threat to companies with just a year or two of runway.

𝐓𝐡𝐞 𝐦𝐨𝐯𝐞 𝐮𝐩𝐦𝐚𝐫𝐤𝐞𝐭 𝐰𝐢𝐥𝐥 𝐛𝐞 𝐬𝐥𝐨𝐰 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐭𝐞𝐝𝐢𝐨𝐮𝐬, 𝐛𝐮𝐭 𝐢𝐭 𝐚𝐥𝐬𝐨 𝐨𝐟𝐟𝐞𝐫𝐬 𝐚 𝐬𝐮𝐬𝐭𝐚𝐢𝐧𝐚𝐛𝐥𝐞 𝐩𝐚𝐭𝐡 𝐭𝐨𝐰𝐚𝐫𝐝𝐬 𝐠𝐫𝐨𝐰𝐭𝐡. 

Start with a lightweight product befitting the SMB and gradually expand it to suit the enterprise. Likewise, adopt SMB-focused high-velocity sales practices and focus on predictable revenue with positive unit economics.

As you master the low-end, start moving upmarket towards larger costumes. Sooner or later, you’ll be hunting occasional whales while still fishing at scale – dominating the SMB and also competing effectively for the enterprise.

𝐆𝐨𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐟𝐨𝐫 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐞𝐫𝐩𝐫𝐢𝐬𝐞 𝐞𝐚𝐫𝐥𝐲 𝐢𝐬 𝐭𝐞𝐦𝐩𝐭𝐢𝐧𝐠, 𝐛𝐮𝐭 𝐭𝐡𝐞𝐫𝐞’𝐬 𝐧𝐨 𝐠𝐨𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐛𝐚𝐜𝐤. 𝐘𝐨𝐮 𝐰𝐢𝐥𝐥 𝐧𝐞𝐯𝐞𝐫 𝐛𝐞 𝐚𝐛𝐥𝐞 𝐭𝐨 𝐠𝐨 𝐝𝐨𝐰𝐧𝐦𝐚𝐫𝐤𝐞𝐭.

Companies that are engineered to sell to the enterprise aren’t agile or lightweight enough to effectively target SMBs. Their deep product is often over-engineered and too expensive for the low end of the market. Their GTM depends on long high-touch sales cycles, driving up Customer Acquisition Costs (CAC). And their reputation in the enterprise sector won’t be as effective when pursuing smaller customers.

𝐀𝐧𝐝 𝐢𝐟 𝐭𝐡𝐞𝐲’𝐫𝐞 𝐧𝐨𝐭 𝐬𝐞𝐥𝐥𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐭𝐨 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐥𝐨𝐰-𝐞𝐧𝐝, 𝐚𝐧𝐤𝐥𝐞 𝐛𝐢𝐭𝐞𝐫𝐬 𝐰𝐢𝐥𝐥 𝐞𝐦𝐞𝐫𝐠𝐞 𝐭𝐨 𝐜𝐡𝐚𝐥𝐥𝐞𝐧𝐠𝐞 𝐭𝐡𝐞𝐦.

Companies that started with SMB customers will eventually mature to compete for the enterprise. They will likely have more efficient sales processes that have been honed over years of high velocity sales. And they will be able to take higher margins or offer cheaper prices thanks to more efficient infrastructure, which is essential when selling to SMBs.

Incumbent enterprise-software vendors will rely on reputation, entrenchment and their balance sheet to shield against ankle biters, but ultimately - efficiency will prevail.

𝐆𝐨𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐮𝐩𝐦𝐚𝐫𝐤𝐞𝐭 𝐢𝐬 𝐝𝐢𝐟𝐟𝐢𝐜𝐮𝐥𝐭. 𝐆𝐨𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐝𝐨𝐰𝐧𝐦𝐚𝐫𝐤𝐞𝐭 𝐢𝐬 𝐢𝐦𝐩𝐨𝐬𝐬𝐢𝐛𝐥𝐞.

My advice to most emerging software companies is start by selling to SMBs and then move upmarket. Why? Competition is weaker at the low-end of the market, barriers to entry are lower, and you can play around with pricing and marketing strategies as you start to build a sustainable customer base.

Moreover, shorter sales cycles offer better opportunities to learn and grow, and you won’t get stuck in months-long procurement, legal and regulatory processes that could pose an existential threat to companies with just a year or two of runway.

𝐓𝐡𝐞 𝐦𝐨𝐯𝐞 𝐮𝐩𝐦𝐚𝐫𝐤𝐞𝐭 𝐰𝐢𝐥𝐥 𝐛𝐞 𝐬𝐥𝐨𝐰 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐭𝐞𝐝𝐢𝐨𝐮𝐬, 𝐛𝐮𝐭 𝐢𝐭 𝐚𝐥𝐬𝐨 𝐨𝐟𝐟𝐞𝐫𝐬 𝐚 𝐬𝐮𝐬𝐭𝐚𝐢𝐧𝐚𝐛𝐥𝐞 𝐩𝐚𝐭𝐡 𝐭𝐨𝐰𝐚𝐫𝐝𝐬 𝐠𝐫𝐨𝐰𝐭𝐡.

𝐆𝐨𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐟𝐨𝐫 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐞𝐫𝐩𝐫𝐢𝐬𝐞 𝐞𝐚𝐫𝐥𝐲 𝐢𝐬 𝐭𝐞𝐦𝐩𝐭𝐢𝐧𝐠, 𝐛𝐮𝐭 𝐭𝐡𝐞𝐫𝐞’𝐬 𝐧𝐨 𝐠𝐨𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐛𝐚𝐜𝐤. 𝐘𝐨𝐮 𝐰𝐢𝐥𝐥 𝐧𝐞𝐯𝐞𝐫 𝐛𝐞 𝐚𝐛𝐥𝐞 𝐭𝐨 𝐠𝐨 𝐝𝐨𝐰𝐧𝐦𝐚𝐫𝐤𝐞𝐭.

Their deep product is often over-engineered and too expensive for the low end of the market. Their GTM depends on long high-touch sales cycles, driving up Customer Acquisition Costs (CAC). And their reputation in the enterprise sector won’t be as effective when pursuing smaller customers.

A single point of contact is a single point of failure. 

Most CSMs know that but still struggle to engage with multiple people within an organisation.

What can you do to become "multi-threaded"? 🧵

Let's start with why being multi-threaded is important. 

We've all experienced a situation where a single point of contact caused a problem: 

💩 a highly engaged person leaves the business and suddenly the entire project flops
💩 a champion who was blind-sighted by their own leadership team, when they made a decision to rip and replace with some other shiny tool
💩 a power user that didn't realise the strategy was shifting and by the time they learned about the changes, decisions had already been made
💩 a business user that was told by finance they need to cut costs in this area by 50% for the next renewal that's happening in 30 days

All of these scenarios leave a CSM in the same situation: too late to build a relationship and influence the key decision-makers.

The outcome 9/10 times is churn. 

So what can you do to become multi-threaded early?

👸🏻 Go High-Up Early
Invite the key decision makers that were involved in the sales process to the first onboarding session, this is an important call to get their perspective on what's important, and what they'd like to see as results. It's a good idea to invite them, or at least send a summary of what was accomplished at the end of the implementation phase.

🗺️ Business Mapping
Early in onboarding spend time with your key business user mapping their workflows and current technology stack. That way you can understand every part of the org that your product touches. When you know how your product impact other areas of the organisation, work on the top 3 integrations or automations you think could add value to their business. Ask your POC to bring these key leaders into a brainstorming meeting. 

📊 EBRs
Send them one-pager summaries of how their business is doing, what the areas of strengths are and what you recommend they work on. Preferably show them how their business is doing against other businesses like them using benchmarking data. 

📡 Scale Communication
Don't forget to maintain each contact in the CRM as a different persona that you and your marketing team can nurture using different content throughout the year!


Do those 4 things and you'll be in a much better position when inevitably your main point of contact steps away or needs to pivot based on key business decisions.

After 10+ years leading teams, the one thing I still struggle with is working with people who complain repeatedly and do nothing about it 😡

I've found 3 things that really help.📚

1- Radical Candour 🤝

I always recommend Kim Scott's book to current and aspiring people leaders. 
It's not just another leadership book. It's the best resource I have ever found when it comes to offering people practical tools to say the hard things when needed. 

In this case, you need to be able to say to someone -> you're consistently complaining about this issue, and I don't see any action. What's stopping you?

The key to making it work is that you've got to build the psych-safety, make it a 2-way avenue, and people need to know you're on their side and you want to see them grow.

2- You are a manager and a coach, not a therapist or a mum. 🦄

Just this week, Lisa Coakley shared an awesome HBR article on 'How to Be a Purpose-Driven Leader Without Burning Out'. 

It puts into elegant words something I've always believed in my gut: your job as a leader is to maximise your positive impact on the mission and to help people solve their own problems through collaboration. It's not to try and make everyone happy by solving their problems.

When you lean too hard into the 'servant-leader' you end up taking too much on to try and help people conquer the challenges they should be conquering on their own.  Guess what? That's why you're burning out. 

Shift your questions from 'what can I do to help you?' to 'what do you need to do to solve this problem?'. 

Then lean on accountability.

3- Stop pouring time and energy into complainers ✋🏻

When you've given feedback openly and honestly, and you've coached around what they can actively do to make a difference, and the person is still not doing anything, it's time to stop pouring time and energy. 

I know this sounds counter-intuitive for managers. 

It definitely sounded like that to me when I first did a Sandler course for leaders.

But the time and energy you are pouring into a person that isn't making an effort to move is time and energy you could be pouring into the people who are making a difference. 

The impact on those who are already making a difference is 10x. 


TLDR - You can't change people. Your responsibility is, to be honest, and to coach. If they don't invest in changing what's bothering them, why should you? 

#csm #customersuccess #leadership #management

Duolingo went from $70 to $369 million in annual revenue in 3 years.

Here are 4 growth strategies they used:

1. Large Market x Freemium Model

In 2022, Online Education was a $146Bn revenue industry. Duolingo addresses this huge market with an innovative freemium model. Users can access most content for $0 but can go premium with extra features for $6.99 monthly. 

→ Address a deep serviceable available market (SAM) with a freemium model.

2. Activation and Retention thanks to Gamification

The hardest part of education apps is keeping users. For this, Duolingo's marketers analyzed popular mobile games. They added similar motivating game mechanics for retention; consecutive days streak, leaderboards, badges, or progress bars.

→ Use gamification principles to increase daily active users (DAUs).

3. Finding the Right North Star metric (CURR)

Duolingo's tried to increase the number of daily active users. After hundreds of A/B tests, they found that the Current User Retention Rate (CURR) had the best impact on DAUs. They created the "Retention team" with CURR as a North Star metric. Definition in the comments.

→ Conduct A/B Tests to choose your teams' North Star metrics.

4. Turning the learning experience into a community

Duolingo added community features to cover the whole AARRR funnel: events, members' courses, referral features, or forums. They transformed the learning experience into a community experience.

→ Install community features to fuel the growth flywheel.

****

Those are 4 of the growth strategies they used to achieve this:

→ 575 million users in 2021
→ 9.6 million daily users in 2021
→ $3.4 billion valuation in 2022

Duolingo's ascent is a masterclass in product marketing and growth strategy.

This post is based on online research - Find the sources in the comments to keep reading about them. Have a look at the first article which explains points 2 and 3 with data.

Things you think as a first time founder that just ain’t so:

1. Good traction or growth is just a couple more features away.

It almost never works like this. Don’t burn time and capital trying to make fetch happen. If you can’t start selling design mockups of your next few months of roadmap, cut bait on the plan attack and keep looking.

2. One time costs are an important concept.

“Well our burn was $600k this quarter, but accccctually it was $450k because we had legal fees, an employee separation, a new office deposit, and a team offsite”

No. There are always one time costs. You burned $600k; your burn is $600k.

3. Fancy Firm X emailed me and wants to talk! They must be interested, and even if not it’ll be good learning for me.

I’ve come to the view that you’re either fundraising, or you’re not fundraising. The entire job of the person who emailed you is to talk to people like you. When you’re not fundraising, *your* job is to avoid all distractions except your only 3 jobs; talk to customers, build product, construct your team.

Do your job, don’t do theirs. Investor conversations when you’re not ready are much worse than a waste of time; they’re a huge distraction.

4. You can hire someone pixel perfect if you just wait long enough and meet enough people.

It doesn’t work this way. You’re looking for diamonds in the rough, if there’s no rough and they’re a real diamond why are they joining your tiny startup?

5. We should invest to avoid tech debt that will cripple us later.

Tech debt is a champagne problem that almost no startup gets the privilege to deal with. You are in the business of taking on debt of all sorts right now to build something so big that you can pay it down later.

6. Our big competitors are terrible.

Saying “they have clunky products with unhappy customers” is another way of saying “they are very feature complete, and customers continue renewing despite frustrations because they solve a real business need.” Respect your competitors.

7. I need coaching on how to be a great leader and advice on how to build strong processes and systems.

No you don’t; not until you’re big. What you need to do is block out all the noise that isn’t talking to customers, building a great product, and constructing the right team.

8. Culture is created on day one. I need to spend the time here to be intentional upfront.

Sounds right, but is wrong. Your culture will naturally flow from how you do your only three jobs. Culture is something you do naturally at first, and intentionally only later.

“HOPE ALL IS WELL”

You know how I feel about this – I hate it.

But data says otherwise.

This phrase actually INCREASES response rates and meetings booked by 24%.

But don’t stop there, add a little something to it.

Make it familiar.

Make it personal.

Make it relevant.

“Chris, hope all is well since your last big product release, I imagine things are pretty busy over there.”

You feel me?

CUSTOMER SUCCESS MANAGERS: How to easily BOOK MEETINGS with DISENGAGED/NON-RESPONSIVE customers 👇 

If you have a customer that is not responding to your outreach emails to book a meeting with you.... just send them a PROACTIVE calendar invite!

Tips:

🕒 Send the calendar invite for a reasonable time during the day, i.e not too early, not too late, not during or either side of lunch.

⏳ Set the calendar invite for 15 minutes - this is a lesser commitment for the customer and gives you enough time to at least explain why you need to meet more often i.e what value you can provide them.

✏ Make the calendar event modifiable and let them know in the meeting description that if the suggested time doesn't work, they have the ability to modify the event and propose alternative dates/times.

📝 Use the description of the calendar invite to explain the nature of the call and why it's IMPORTANT, be concise.

Why does this work so well? Because people CARE what’s in their CALENDAR a lot more than what's in their inbox. The calendar invite cannot be ignored, they will accept, decline, reschedule or reply but the likelihood is it will not be IGNORED. 

Simple and effective, try it! 😎 

How do you book meetings with disengaged customers?

~Follow me for more Customer Success Manager tactical tips and advice~

The biggest challenge for any SaaS company post $2-3M ARR is most likely to be churn and technical debt. 

Especially when you grow too much too fast. Too many customers. Too many bugs. Too many feature requests.

It’s OK. Take a year or two to settle down (even if growth stalls). You’ll move a lot faster afterwards. 

It took UiPath 10 years to get to $1M ARR; and then 5 years to get to $600M ARR. 

Be patient. It really pays off.

Daily Facts® : Message of the day!

A man saw a snake being burned to death and decided to take it out of the fire. When he did, the snake bit him causing excruciating pain. The man dropped the snake, and the reptile fell right back into the fire. 

So, the man looked around and found a metal pole and used it to  take the snake out of the fire, saving its life.

Someone who was watching approached the man and said: “That snake bit you. Why are you still trying to save it?”

The man replied: “The nature of the snake is to bite, but that's not going to change my nature, which is to help.”

Moral of the story:
Do not change your nature simply because someone harms you. Do not lose your good heart, but learn to take precautions.

About 2 weeks ago I was presented with an incredible opportunity to meet with #DrNgoziOkonjoIweala through the firm I work at, Grant Thornton Israel Fahn Kanne. Dr. Okonjo-Iweala has an incredible history. Originally from Nigeria, Okonjo-Iweala spent a 25-year career at the World Bank in Washington DC as a development economist, rising to the No. 2 position of Managing Director. As Managing Director, she had oversight responsibility for the World Bank’s $81 billion operational portfolio in Africa, South Asia, Europe and Central Asia. She also served two terms as the first female Finance Minister of Nigeria. She is a brilliant person to say the least. She led a discussion about Israeli innovative solutions for Africa and I think it is very important to share the key point from the meeting. Today she serves on the board of several organizations including Twitter! An important note from the discussion:

Dr. Okonjo-Iweala noted that it was time to move from the pilots stage to the significant implementation phase of the projects in the field. "It's time to scale up! "

#טיפ_קטן: למה סטארט-אפים ישראליים צריכים שותפים מקומיים בחו"ל, ואיך זה קשור למלחמה של טראמפ בטיקטוק? >>>

אם במסגרת הפעילות של החברה אתם אוספים מידע על הציבור (ובינינו, כמעט ואין היום חברה שלא עושה זאת) ויש לכם סניף בינלאומי, אנו ממליצים בחום להיעזר בשותף מקומי מאותה ארץ זרה. 
מדוע?

ישנו כמובן ההיבט של ההיכרות עם ההתנהלות החוקית והביורוקרטית הפנים-מדינתית. 
אך לא פחות חשוב מכך הוא הצורך לשדר בפני הרשויות המקומיות שהחברה היא לא זרה לחלוטין ושיש לכם אינטרסים רבים ושורשיים במדינה, כך שחשוב לכם לציית לחוק אפילו "יותר מהאפיפיור". כך, במקרים מסויימים, ניתן יהיה להפיג, או לכל הפחות להפחית חששות בנוגע למסחר או חשיפת מידע הנאסף או שעובד על תושבי אותה המדינה. 

ממש לאחרונה קיבלנו דוגמה חיה לכך במקרה של אפליקציית טיקטוק הסינית: ממשל טראמפ הסכים שהיא תימכר בחלקה לחברה מקומית אמריקנית, לא מכיוון שעצם הפעילות שלה אסורה אלא בגלל המידע המקומי שנחשף ליישות זרה.

מנהלים ואנשי HR - הפוסט הזו הוא בשבילכם!

התפרצות נגיף הקורונה משבשת את ההתנהלות היומית באופן משמעותי ולצערנו אנחנו עלולים למצוא את עצמנו בשגרת חירום עוד זמן רב.

לקוחותינו בעולם שיתפו אותנו בדוגמאות כיצד הם מנהלים תקשורת אפקטיבית עם העובדים בעת המשבר ואני שמח לשתף גם אתכם:

המלצות לתקשורת פנים ארגונית נכונה:

1.    שלטו בנרטיב - אל תתנו לעובדים להיות מוזנים ממידע לא אמין ולהניח הנחות שגויות.

2.    אל תתנו לשמועות ו"פייק ניוז" לרוץ בארגון - עצרו את זה כמה שיותר מהר באמצעות תקשורת יזומה ומהירה.

3.    הציגו לעובד את כל הפעולות שאתם עושים כדי לייצר סביבת עבודה בטוחה, זכרו שחלק מהעובדים נמצאים באי ודאות וחשש עקב המידע הרץ ברשת.

4.    ההנחיות בישראל ובמדינות שונות בעולם מתעדכנות ערב-ערב, כיצד זה משפיע על אחרון העובדים ביום למחרת?

שאלות שעובדים מעלים ויש צורך לספק מענה ארגוני:

1.    איך אני יודע שהחברה עושה מה שצריך כדי להגן עלי?

2.    מה יקרה אם ימצאו מישהו חולה בחברה?

3.    מה הנהלים לגבי ימי חופש? מחלה? מה יקרה עם השכר במקרה כזה?

4.   מה אני עושה אם יש לי או לבני משפחתי חשש להידבקות?

6.    איך אני יודע שקולגות שלי לא נשאים?

7.    מה קורה עם הפרויקט שלי/ אירועי החברה?
 
לאופן שבו המידע יתוקשר לעובדים ישנה חשיבות רבה, לכך אתייחס בפוסט הבא...

במידה ותרצו להתייעץ  לגבי תקשורת-פנים אפקטיבית, אתם מוזמנים ליצור איתי קשר בפרטי.

So after a few weeks off, it's finally time to make it LinkedIn official :)

After an incredible journey of 6 years at monday.com, in roles that have shaped and enriched my professional and personal experiences, I am excited to share that I am embarking on a new adventure! 🚀

Last week I officially joined the rockstars at Connecteam as the Head of Customer Success Mid Tier! 

I'm very eager to start writing this new chapter, but a few goodbyes are in order to some people I'm lucky enough to call my work family (and friends for life!).
I wouldn't be where I am today without the unwavering support and guidance of my fantastic managers Tom Ronen and Nir Fogel - thank you for always pushing me to reach new heights!
A huge shoutout to my monday.com team of CS masters - thank you for trusting me, teaching me, and helping me create the ultimate collaborative and achieving environment any manager can only dream of! 

So, thanks to Noam Serlin and the rest of the team at Connecteam for the opportunity - bring on all the challenges and opportunities, I'm pumped for what's coming next!  🌟 

#NewBeginnings #ExcitingTimes

Last week I celebrated 5 years at monday.com 🌟

5 years
4 positions
3 managers (Shout out to Effie Arman, Tom Ronen and Nir Fogel!)
2 offices
1 amazing company turned into my 2nd home and family

Friends, memories, challenges, laughs? countless.

I can't wait to continue and grow with this unicorn (or should I say llama) of a company and see what's more to come!

Once a year, monday.com holds a company-wide engagement survey to see how happy team members are - one of the most important indicators to a company’s true success in my opinion.

Back in October 2021, my Client Services team didn’t quite get the results we were hoping to achieve. It seemed like we had some improvements to make if we wanted to keep our people happy, motivated, and confident in their place at monday.

Together with the rest of the Client Services leadership team, we decided to jump on the opportunity to make some exciting changes!
We immediately decided, together with our OG HR team (Hadas Mor-Feldbau, Shir Yahav, and Jaimee George) to do another survey in 6 months - meaning we had 6 months to plan, prioritize, and make a difference.
It was quite the ride. Full of challenges, brainstorming, and successes!

But, we are not done yet.
Maintaining a highly-motivated, happy-to-come-to-work-in-the-morning team is a never-ending process - but its one we are very happy to put all our efforts in.

How did we do it exactly?
Listen to Nir Fogel, our Client Services director tell the full story!

https://bit.ly/3SxhzqR

#leadership #team

Last week I had the privilege to talk to the very first generation of students at our Customer Success #MondayU!
For more than an hour, we talked about onboarding, implementation, and professional services - three topics that are very close to my heart.

For those of you that don't know, #MondayU is an amazing initiative by monday.com, designed to help people gain the initial knowledge they need to kick start their hi-tech career!
5 years ago I was lucky enough to learn from those on my team (Hi Tom Ronen and Effie Arman!) the ins and outs of this domain. And now, we have a whole university dedicated just for that - the building block of any successful company - Customer Success.

Want to join us? we're hiring!
my amazing wife Hila Sasson  is saving the world from global warming. Care to join?

Almost 4 years ago I was lucky enough to join an amazing group of people on a world-changing journey. 
During these past years I got front row seats to watch Dapulse evolve into monday.com, and see our inspiring vision come to life.

Hold tight...we are just getting started!

#mndy #nasdaqlisted

When covid struck Israel back in March 2020, I quickly found myself, like so many others, out of a job. I knocked on many doors, but none seemed to open. Several challenging months had gone by, until one day a friend from school suggested I apply to JOLT. She described it as part startup and part school, and a place where I can both work and learn.
 
Little did I know how right she was. Hardly a day passed by where I didn’t learn something new, or was challenged by a new situation or task. At JOLT, things move fast, they get broken, reshaped and improved. Never before did I work in an environment that not only welcomed but demanded feedback and critique as a tool to become better and deliver on its promise.
 
Thank you Jolt.io for an extraordinary time, for the countless challenges and lessons, and for letting me be part of this incredible team and mission. 
 
#Goodbye #Newadventures

Another Connecteam sales department spotlight coming up 🌟

This time it is Katya Zalevski! Katya joined us last October and has made a huge impact to the team so far 🔝
Due to that fact, she took on the important role of leading the learning and development of the entire department. 👏🏼

💥How does it feel to receive extra responsibility at such an early stage of working at Connecteam ?
I didn't expect it. I knew all along that I wanted to take on new projects, once I was done refining my day-to-day after the onboarding, so I was surprised and intrigued by this new opportunity. It makes me feel so appreciated by the company, and this is something I hadn't experienced elsewhere.

💥So what exactly is your new role in the sales team?
I'm responsible to make sure the whole sales team is qualified according to their seniority in the company and lead anybody in the department to personal and professional career development within Connecteam.  
Allowing anybody to find their personal passion in the sales department and express themselves in their own unique way.
On top of that, one of my responsibilities is meeting the department's knowledge accessible and available to everyone.

️💥What does your daily routine look like?
Most of my clients are from North America therefore I'm start my day at noon, working on projects and making sure that everyone is progressing with their qualifications. Additionally, I'm working on new qualifications and courses for the team, to expand their knowledge.
Then, at around 4 pm, it's sales time! Reaching out to my clients, doing product demonstrations, and making sure I'm on top of my pipeline!

💥Do you feel you have a big impact on the department?
It is amazing to know that every month, I open a new door for each of the employees in the department. I feel like my voice and opinions are really being heard and it is really exciting to be able to get so creative and passionate about something.

Give it up for Katya Zalevski !!! 
Proud to be your team member 🙌🏽

 #sales #opportunity #employeeappreciation #recognition

So today I'm going to continue to explain some more about what’s happening at Connecteam 's Sales team :)
Last time I mentioned the many sales roles that were handed out to our team members, today we are going to dive into the first →
Head of no-touch clients. 
So the spotlight turns to the one and only Yuval Rimon 👑

⭐️ How does it feel to receive extra responsibility at such an early stage of working at Connecteam?
"The fact that I’m being trusted with such a serious responsibility at this early stage really makes me feel appreciated and that the leadership at Connecteam truly believes in me as a professional."

⭐️ So what exactly is your new role in the sales team?
"My role is head of our no-touch clients. Basically, we have clients who sign up to our platform and end up paying for Connecteam without actually having a direct Account manager. My role is to make sure they have all the answers they need in order to make the right decision on their own."

⭐️ What does your daily routine look like?
"My daily routine usually splits into two parts - Working on the projects I’m in charge of: research, strategic planning, and meeting with the different personas across the company - And of course in the afternoon: Sales-Sales-Sales!"

⭐️ Do you feel you have a big impact on the department?
"It certainly feels like I’m in a position to make a big change - In the field we’re in, moving the needle in the slightest can cause a massive effect on our revenue.
As much of a cliche as this might sound - I actually feel like I’m appreciated and “seen” not only for my hard work but for my potential as well, which to me - means everything."

#sales #team #leadership #tech #hightech

This week in Connecteam 's sales department we handed out new roles to many of our team members who have been in the department for 6-10 months. 🏅

These positions include:
1️⃣ Leading our recruiting process. 
2️⃣ Coordinating our work with the CS department
3️⃣ Managing our learning and development
4️⃣ Managing our “Sales Academy” - our weekly sessions on improving our sales techniques
5️⃣ Leading our on-boarding process
6️⃣ Managing our webinars and no-touch processes 
7️⃣ Leading our sales development in the APAC region
8️⃣ Head of culture in the sales department

Being an account executive in our team takes a lot of effort, but that doesn’t take away from the need for personal development, growth inside the company, and taking on new challenges. It is our responsibility for everyone, from a very early stage in our department, to experience new horizons, to contribute in other ways inwards and not just outwards, and make a MAJOR impact on the sales department and on the company as a whole. 🌍

So what do these roles actually mean? More information in future posts :)

Give it up for Qeshet Harrison Yaara Tirosh David Kovarsky Yaki Koz Katya Zalevski Dan Samama Yuval Rimon 🙌🏽

#sales #growth # #development

וואו, איזה מדהים היה בועידה ה-18 לניהול משאבי אנוש!

מאות מנהלות ומנהלים מתחום משאבי אנוש הגיעו לכנס שהתקיים ב-14.11.21 בתל אביב, וזו הייתה הזדמנות נהדרת גם עבורנו לפגוש פנים מול פנים חלק נכבד מלקוחותינו אחרי תקופה ארוכה מידי של ריחוק וכנסים וירטואליים.

שמחתי להיות בין הדוברים הראשיים בכנס ולשתף אודות החידושים השונים בתחום משאבי אנוש וכיצד הלקוחות של Connecteam מיישמים אותם לצד האתגרים השונים שרובנו מכירים ואשמח לשתף אתכם בכמה נקודות מעניינות מתוך ההרצאה שלי:

☝️79% משוק העבודה העולמי עדיין מורכב מחברות שמרבית העובדים שלהן אינם נגישים למחשב במהלך יום העבודה, ולמרביתם אין בכלל אימייל ארגוני

☝️בחברות בהן לחלק ניכר מהעובדים אין אימייל ארגוני, אין אפשרות להגיע לכלל העובדים בכל הקשור להעברת מסרים ארגוניים, תפעוליים וחברתיים

☝️מה שלא יהיה פשוט, פשוט לא יהיה: פשטות ומהירות הן הסוד להטמעה נכונה ולהגברת השימושיות, והן מלוות אותנו ב- Connecteam עם כל מוצר חדש שאנו מפתחים

☝️למידה במנות קטנות היא מפתח לחוויית למידה איכותית, מודרנית, וקלה ליישום

☝️טכנולוגיה ללא מתודולוגיה - תיכשל: הכלי הטכנולוגי הוא נלווה לתהליך, ולא להפך

☝️חווית עובד ב-2021 היא קריטית: העובדים שלכם מצפים לחוויה מדהימה מאפליקציה. כמו שקל להם להזמין אוכל או להעביר כסף באמצעות אפליקציה, כך הם מצפים שהתקשורת הארגונית באפליקציה תהיה גם היא קלה, פשוטה, עבורם ובשבילם

רוצים לצפות בהרצאה מתוך הכנס? תכינו לכם כוס קפה וקחו 15 דקות לצפייה. מבטיח שלא תתחרטו!

תרגישו חופשי לכתוב לי בתגובות או לשלוח הודעה פרטית. אשמח לענות על כל שאלה!

Connecteam Israel

איך מנהלים תקשורת פנים ארגונית באופן אפקטיבי? וכמה הדבר חיוני להצלחת הארגון?

איפה זה פוגש אותנו: 
✅ היכולת להגיע לאחרון העובדים בצורה אפקטיבית ורציפה
✅ היכולת לוודא שכל הארגון ראה וקרא את נוהל הבטיחות החדש
✅ היכולת להעביר הכשרת עובדים בזמן קצר והבנה מיטבית של החומר
✅  היכולת לשתף בקידום עובדים, ימי הולדת, שנים בחברה בצורה בה כולם יהיו חשופים לזה ויוכלו לחגוג יחד
✅ היכולת להיות בבעלות על המידע ולדעת שהוא מאובטח ומנוהל
✅ היכולת להפריד בין תקשורת אישית לתקשורת בענייני עבודה 
✅ היכולת להמנע מתביעות דיני עבודה סביב תקשורת שמתבצעת דרך הוואטסאפ

אלון רפאל, מנהל הפעילות העסקית של קונקטים בישראל, מסביר כיצד הדרך שבה מנהלים תקשורת פנים ארגונית קריטית להצלחת הארגון, ואיך אפליקציה ייעודית לתקשורת פנים ארגונית יכולה להיות הכלי הנכון!

🎧 אם אתם בעלי עסקים קטנים או גדולים או מנהלים בארגון, קחו 22 דקות להאזין לכתבת הפודקאסט המלאה שאולי תוכל להיות הדבר הכי טוב שקרה לארגון שלכם.

העולם השתנה והדור החדש של המנהלים והעובדים שגדלו על טכנולוגיה ושימוש בטלפונים החכמים לכל פעולה בחיים, מבינים שכך צריך גם בארגון בו הם עובדים כדי לחבר את העובדים לארגון, לייעל תהליכים, לאפשר לעסק לצמוח במהירות, ולמנהלים לנהל את העסק בצורה מקיפה וחכמה יותר תוך ראיית תמונה רחבה של הארגון וביצוע פעולות בקליק. 

"האתגר המשמעותי ביותר הוא לשנות את הקונספט ואת החשיבה של מנהלים שחושבים שהעובדים לא יכולים להסתדר עם טכנולוגיה..החיים הפרטיים שלנו הפכו למשודרגים יותר, וזה מוזר מאוד לא לקחת את זה לכיוון העסקי".

כמו שלכל עסק יש אתר אינטרנט, לכל עסק צריכה להיות אפליקציה לניהול עובדים. 

טכנולוגיה זו הדרך לגשר על הפער בין הדורות. 

לחצו על הלינק לקרוא את הכתבה המלאה 👇

#Bankingg the #Unbanked" during the COVID19 crisis"
SparkBeyond is proud to partner with Speckle Financial Health the social enterprise which is powered by NAB to #Bank the “unbanked“ and help Australians who are under #financial stress during the #covid19 crisis. 
There is no better way to serve our mission and vision and #Derisk and support the underprivileged”

Speckle provides affordable digital loans and budgeting to help people better manage money. 100% of profits are reinvested to scale their impact. When Covid-19 hit, their mission became more urgent and they wanted to explore how they could use #data to expand their reach and better support those who were most vulnerable.
SparkBeyond found out that In a global crisis the last two months of data is more valuable than the previous two years and is crucial when navigating through a post-Covid world.
Within hours, SparkBeyond’s platform surfaced insights that would help Speckle better understand default #risk. As Speckle continues to grow, SparkBeyond will help automate #credit decisioning and reduce costs so Speckle can scale their #impact  and build a more financially resilient community.

1️⃣| Do you find that Covid-era disruptions make mission-critical forecasting systems no longer reliable?

A top-3 consumer electronics company reduced costs by >$80Mn through increased demand forecasting accuracy (last 2-wk's of data used to predict the next wk's demand)

2️⃣| Do you find value in leveraging e-commerce as a representative test & learn platform on consumer LTV?

A top-5 UK retailer discovered >25 actionable loyalty program shopper micro-segments with an avg. 2.3x spend-stretch potential (fortnight auto refresh discovers new segments);

3️⃣| Are you concerned that without rebuilding media modeling to match shifted consumer needs, your brand risks losing equity built in decades past?

An EMEA digital product offering drove higher engagement through 25% lower marketing spend (covid-era relevant propensity scoring allows "doing more with less")

פלספנות והייטק - הולך בייחד.

הפער הזה בין ריאלי לאידיאלי, 
מושג מהותי בתאוריה של קרל רוג’רס.
חודשיים וחצי לקח לי להבין איך למצוא עבודה,
 הבנתי שזו שפה בפני עצמה,
הבנתי שלהיות יהיר זו בחירה לא נבונה,
הבנתי שלהיות משוחרר ולהיות עצמך זו הדרך לליבם של אנשים,
הבנתי שבעצם ההבדל בין מועמד חזק יותר לחזק פחות זה שילוב נכון של בטחון עצמי וצניעות,
הבנתי שאתה לא לומד מהראיונות כמו שאתה לומד מהרגע של לפני והרגע של אחרי,
הבנתי שרובנו אנשים טובים וכשמדובר בעזרה הדדית אנחנו נטולי אינטרסים,
ולכן אני מבקש מכל מי שחושב שאבדה עליו אמונתו והוא כבר לא אותו האידיאל של אתמול,
שיעמוד על שתי רגליים אחוריות, ידבר עם עצמו, יזכיר לעצמו שהוא השיג את כל מטרותיו והידע שלו בזכות עצמו,
שהוא בחר את הבחירות שלו בחייו, ואם הוא למד, התקדם והתחבר לאנשים אז כנראה שהוא טוב במה שהוא עושה.

ובעיקר שנזכור שגם ברגעים הכי נמוכים שלנו יש לנו את האנשים שקרובים אלינו, הזכרון החיובי מהעבר הלא רחוק,
 ובעיקר את האמונה בעצמנו שאם הנפוך אותה לריאלית, אז שם למטה, איפה שנראה לנו הכי רחוק מאידיאל, היא תשאיר אותנו עם הראש מעל המים.

אחריי חודשיים וחצי של אבטלה,
ללא שום הצעה קונקרטית,
ראיונות טובים יותר וטובים פחות, שלבים סופיים, אכזבות, מלחמה בתסכול וכך שוב ושוב,
בשבוע האחרון היו לי 2 הצעות עבודה על השולחן וכמעט היו שלושה,
אני יכול לעמוד ולהגיד תמשיכו להיות אתם, זה הכי קל והכי נכון...
כל מילה...

**הזדמנות פז לעשות מעשה טוב!**
רועי, לקוי ראייה, איבד את מקום עבודתו בעקבות סגירת המוקד בו עבד. לרועי יש  ניסיון כנציג טלפוני והוא יכול להשתלב בכל מוקד. רועי עובד חרוץ, לויאלי למקום עבודתו, עומד בכל יעדיו וכיף לעבוד איתו.
אז תהיו טובים, תגיבו, תציעו ותנו לו הזדמנות! בהצלחה!

roy-halevy.postDetails: 🚀 Thrilled to announce my new journey as an Account Executive at Connecteam! 🌐

היי חברים! 
 
כמו נילס הולגרסון, אני פורש כנפיים ומחפש את משרת החלומות הבאה שלי ! 
 
עד היום יצא לי לגעת בלא מעט תחומים בתעשייה תוך עבודה בכמה משרות מדהימות כמו מכירות בריטייל, אנליסט כספים ומתאם שיתופי פעולה טכנולוגיים ופיתוח עסקי בחברת ייעוץ לחברות טק. המשרות האלה עזרו לי לבסס את הכיוון שאני רוצה להתמחות בו, פיתוח עסקי ומכירות בהייטק.
 
מעבר לניסיון הטכני שצברתי בעבודה עם בסיסי נתונים באקסל, עבודה עם מערכות ERP, הכנת מחקרי שווקים ועוד, אני מביא איתי גם ניסיון בתקשורת מול אנשי ניהול בכירים ברמה בינלאומית (עם פוקוס על השוק הסיני), יכולת הבנה מהירה והצגה של טכנולוגיות מורכבות, הכרה של שיטות עבודה ואסטרטגיה של חברות מתחומים ובגדלים שונים וכמובן ארגזים של מוטיבציה להתחיל קריירה בפיתוח עסקי ומכירות.
 
אני פריק של טכנולוגיות חדשות ולמזלי בעבודה הנוכחית שלי יצא לי להיחשף לכל כך הרבה טכנולוגיות ובכל כך הרבה תחומים. אין לי ספק שאם היינו קמים בבוקר 15 שנה מהיום ומסתכלים מהחלון, לא היינו מזהים מה הולך מסביב. אני רוצה להיות חלק מהמהפכה הזאת ולקדם את הטכנולוגיות שישנו את העולם! 
 
אני מחפש את המקום שייתן לי את ההזדמנות לשבור את פרדוקס הג'וניור ולהוכיח שבעזרת לא מעט ניסיון והמון רעב להצלחה, בשילוב עם חברה מדהימה ומוצר עוד יותר מדהים, השמיים הם הגבול!
 
אני סופר אשמח אם תתנו בלייק, תתנו בשיתוף ואם גם שמעתם או יש לכם משרה להציע תגיבו / שלחו הודעה 😊
 
תודה לכולם!!
 
אגב אני גם מעביר סדנאות קוקטיילים, מבשל בירה חובב (תחת המותג "Prince_Of_Ashkenaz" באינסטוש) ויש לי מתכון לבצק פיצה מטריפה! כל זה חלק מעסקת החבילה 😉

yehuda-sh.postDetails:
As someone who doesn’t post often, I can’t help but acknowledge the amazing opportunity I had last week. With very short notice, I embarked on a last-minute trip to the UAE. Together with a few colleagues, we recognized it as the perfect time to visit some of our clients in Dubai and Abu Dhabi.

Witnessing firsthand how these large companies operate was truly eye-opening. Their significant impact in the region and on a global scale is remarkable, and it is a privilege to play an integral role in their success and growth.

Now that I’m back, there’s a wealth of knowledge and insights to unpack from all the meetings and everything I learned last week. I am eagerly looking forward to applying these lessons and experiences in our ongoing efforts to grow and strengthen our department and team.

Overall, I’m grateful that I seized the opportunity without overthinking or having a perfect plan in place beforehand. I am confident that the valuable insights gained from this trip will greatly impact my clients and contribute to the success of my team as a whole! 🚀 ✈️ 

#CustomerSuccess #AccountManagement #SAAS #UAE #dubai #abudhabi #growth

danit-alaluf-742a581b9.postDetails:
Never thought I would fall in love with a workplace.

It’s already been a year since I joined Connecteam, who have become my second family.

Before joining this amazing team, I managed a youth at risk center. It was a meaningful experience for me which had a tremendous social impact. So it’s not surprising that when I first considered transitioning to the high tech industry, I was extremely afraid. Afraid I would lose the values that were so important to me, such as empathy and compassion, helping people and communities. 

And then a lot of magic started happening :) From the moment I was hired and even during the interviews, I realized that Connecteam shares these same values. I'm grateful to work for a company that not only provides innovative solutions but also cares so much about its customers, employees, and society. Every few months, we put all the business matters aside and contribute our time and energy by volunteering.

Over the past year, I've had the privilege of meeting interesting people (my clients) who own businesses, manage organizations, and run companies. I take the time to understand their needs and pains, and how we can provide a solution to help them succeed. It's an honor for me to also learn from them and bring their insights to our team so we can continue to grow and deliver even better solutions. 

I'm excited about my future here and the opportunities for my growth and development. I'm grateful for the experiences and skills I've gained over the past year, and above all, the people who are in this journey with me and who I truly admire. I look forward to many more great experiences to come. Thank you to all my awesome colleagues and beloved friends at Connecteam for making this past year such a memorable one! 

#workanniversary #connecteam #accountexecutive #sales #business #impact #teamwork #growth #opportunities #learning #success #grateful #thankyou

Bringing on a new vendor is never as easy as we think it should be.

As a sales-person, I'm usually on the other end of the table. The process typically includes: * Sales calls * Demos * Price negotiation * Setting up a pilot * Sharing feedback * Due diligence * Legal * Making the final decision *

It's all about ensuring the product unequivocally fits your needs, proves an ROI, and gets internal, universal buy-in.


But our experience with Loxo has been incredible. Their management went up and beyond to help our team with implementation and furthermore, were exceptionally sensitive and accommodating to our needs as we were interrupted by the Hamas attacks and security situation in Israel.

In case you haven't heard of Loxo, it's a brilliant and easy-to-use, content management platform for sales, and during the pilot, it helped drive our buyer's journey and resulted in a 6-figure ARR acquisition.

On a personal note, I would like to sincerely thank the team there Sarah Blank, Joel Willcocks & Toby Willcocks. You have my endorsement and complete recommendation.

Many people are quick to (correctly) point out that this is a business networking platform, and not a political platform.

So, in order to keep this about business.....

We are fighting for our countries survival, and the survival of both social AND economic liberty. Without Israeli technology, how would your company/business/personal life be affected?

Now this is integrity.

Wix leadership deserves immense credit for taking appropriate action against deeply inappropriate behavior. 👏 

LinkedIn is a business networking platform. Some of the major global tech companies have shown a moral conscience by refusing to endorse terror and thus maintained their brand positivity. It's a shame that they were forced to do this in the first place. 

It's simple, If you value: 
* Democracy 
* Economic growth
* Technological advances in healthcare, agriculture, and the environment
* Equality in the workplace
* Fair trade
* Jobs for Palestinians 

Support Israel.

Be like Wix.

From a fan of Rangers, the historic arch-rival of Celtic (for those unaware), it will seem like an opportunity to have a sly dig.

However, this is far from the truth. I type now as a Jew, and an Israeli citizen.
My fellow Jewish people feel uncomfortable watching live sport at the stadium, where Celtic Football Club is complicit in allowing terrorist flags to be flown and Jew-hatred lauded.

Organizations around Europe and North America, including AWS, Intel, Google, Salesforce and hundreds of others have shown there is a price to be paid by celebrating murder, and libeling Israels' response - they have canceled attendance of events like Web Summit to show solidarity for the victims of Hamas murder spree. Respect to them all. 

If they can do it, so can others.

Do adidas, WilliamHill, Cocacola Now, Vitality, EA SPORTS, wish to be associated with an organisation that endorses this?

But for the purposes of integrity, I wonder if sane-minded people from all walks of life, who may or may not like football - even fans of Celtic, would come out and make a stand.

Another working week is almost over here in Israel 🇮🇱.

Most of us who aren't in Miluim or serving in our defense forces are trying to get on with lives as usual - when of course, it is anything but - as the war rumbles on and more and more information about the horrors come to light.

I've spoken to many who feel guilty about working, spending money, having fun, going to the gym or even simply smiling. It's all very understandable and expected.

However, I sincerely believe we have a duty to ensure that those fighting on the front line for our beautiful country's future, have something special to come back home to.

By working as best we can, spending money and keeping the economy going, keeping gyms and restaurants in business, and maintaining our sanity - the brave heroes will return to a functioning Israel that resembles our collective home, the one all of us argue about every day 😊 

It isn't the army, navy, or air force, but living life IS contributing. In fact, it's critical. We can't force a smile when happiness is hard to find at the moment. But our fighting spirit and survival instincts are natural.

- and we should lean into this with everything we have.

Wishing you all a safe and healthy Shabbat ☀

Interview processes are both mechanical, and arduous - here could be some reasons why:

According to Legaljobs, on average - 118 people will apply for a single job position, while only 20% of applicants will reach the interview stage. The average interview lasts 53 minutes, which means that after the time spent filtering through CV/LinkedIn Profiles, interviewers will then spend 1272 minutes (21.2 hours) in interviews.

That's some significant man/woman-hours taken up, especially when you're competing with hundreds of other companies for the same talent pool.

Want to know how to:
* Find untapped talent
* Reduce your inflated hiring costs
* Know your candidates better

Click here and I will personally reach out to you:

10 years exactly since I arrived in Israel and got my inaugural Hitech SaaS role.

I'm regularly asked for advice by job-seekers looking to either move companies, or try their hand in the industry for the very first time.

What I've learned in the subsequent decade since starting out as an SMB Sales Executive can be simplified into cliches.

* Work smart, not long hours.
* Pick a product you love working with.
* Surround yourself with people you love working with.
* Don't be motivated by money or title, but respect your own value.
* Be unafraid to fail once in a while. That's how we learn.
* Lose the self-entitlement.

מכירים מישהו שמחפש מנהל מוצר מתחיל שעבר תהליך מיון שלם בהצלחה? 

אמ;לק - חתמתי על חוזה ראשון כמנהל מוצר, התקן בוטל ברגע האחרון 

היי לינקדאין, 
אני דן, נעים להכיר :) 

יש לי ניסיון של 4.5 שנים בעולמות הCyber Security ובשנתיים האחרונות עבדתי כ-Product Owner וכראש צוות אנליסטים. בשנתיים אלו התאהבתי בעולם ניהול המוצר וידעתי שזה הכיוון שאליו אני שואף להתקדם. 

במהלך החודשים האחרונים הרגשתי מוכן להגשים את החלום שלי והתחלתי לחפש משרה ראשונה בניהול מוצר. 

התמיינתי לחברה שחיפשה מנהל מוצר עם ניסיון, ועברתי תהליך מיון ממושך וקפדני: ראיון product sense, מטלת בית, פרזנטציה, תרגיל פרודקטי/טכני על המוצר של החברה בlive, ראיון עם חברי הצוות, ראיון HR, שיחה עם הפאונדר וממליצים. 
עבדתי קשה, למדתי, השקעתי, ולבסוף חתמתי על חוזה הPM שכל כך רציתי. 

כבר עזבתי את מקום העבודה הקודם (התקן שלי כבר אויש) והייתי אמור להתחיל את התפקיד בימים הקרובים, אבל לצערי הודיעו לי שהחוזה שלי בוטל בעקבות הקפאת גיוסים. 
לצד האכזבה, אני מנסה להסתכל על כל מצב כהזדמנות וכבר מחפש את האתגר הבא שלי כמנהל מוצר 💪🏻

למרות המצב הקשה בשוק, אני מאמין שהעובדה שחתמתי על חוזה עבור משרה שדרשה ניסיון כמנהל מוצר, לאחר שעברתי תהליך מיון קפדני ומקיף, מעידה משהו על הכישורים שלי, הבשלות שלי לתפקיד והרעב שלי ללמוד, והייתי שמח להוכיח גם לכם שיש לי את זה 🙂 

אני פתוח לכל רעיון, אוהב ללמוד ולומד מהר. יש לי אנגלית ברמת שפת אם, הרבה ניסיון client facing ויכולת execution מעולה. 

אם יש לכם רעיון למשרת ניהול מוצר/מוצר אוריינטד/כל הזדמנות מרגשת ומשמעותית בכל תחום, הייתי יותר משמח שנדבר. 

תודה על הקריאה 🙏🏻

The journey has come to an end! 

Excited to share my completion of the Global Village for Future Leaders 2023 at Lehigh University and Iacocca Institute at Lehigh University. 

I am deeply grateful to represent Reichman University as an ambassador of our institution and my country, Israel. This program has been truly enriching, fostering connections with 55 villagers from 38 diverse countries. It has provided invaluable insights into different cultures, strengthening my leadership and entrepreneurship skills.

A sincere thanks to the organizers and my fellow villagers for making this adventure unforgettable. Your support and inspiration have significantly impacted my personal and professional development.
Proud to be part of this team

Last Thursday my team and I had the pleasure of presenting my venture at the CannabisTech vertical at Reichman University. Our innovative solution aims to improve the lives of those living with epilepsy through CBD patches. It was an exciting experience to be part of the conversation on the potential cannabis healthcare. Thanks Reichman University (IDC Herzliya)  and Omer Zerahia for the opportunity!

Last weekend I attended the International Franchise Expo in NY with Connecteam.

At the event, we interviewed franchisors and gave them the opportunity to showcase their uniqueness and offering to potential franchisees, as part of our Franchise With Us initiative. 

Besides being a great success, a thrilling experience, and meeting a lot of interesting people, I really found it amazing how much you can learn from one event when meeting people in person and hearing their stories. We spoke with some super interesting people!

The insights I personally gained would probably have taken me many months to get to with my daily routine.

Industry events are a great way to collaborate, gain industry insights, network, and have a good time. And of course, for the foodies out there, it's always fun to taste some local cuisine:)

Before publishing this new position on our website, I wanted to share with my attorney friends that we're looking for an In-house Counsel for Connecteam!

This is a great chance to join one of the most growing startups in Israel, and the global industry leader in what we do. Plus, it's a rare opportunity to build something out of nothing, and really make a mark and an impact.

In our perspective, a good In-house Counsel is:
 
>> A business partner that manages risks and thinks what CAN be done, and not only what can’t be done

>> Someone that understands how to play nice with others, that knows how to collaborate with other colleagues from other departments, and that can speak the language that makes it easy for non-legal partners to understand and act upon

>> A responsible manager that understands when is the time to raise a red flag before damage is being done

>> A proactive person. We’re looking for counsel that will actively sync with others and establish themselves as a trusted advisor

>> We’re not looking for a counsel that just waits for others to approach them or for a task to come in

>> Someone that is the HR and Business’ best friend, that’s helping the company to work and manage things responsibly while moving forward without a “no, we can’t” attitude

Sounds awesome, right? DM me for questions or to kick off the hiring process.

For more about Connecteam, you can visit us at connecteam.com :)

Hello LinkedIn friends and community!

I’ve recently started a little side project that connects my professional experience in impact and sustainability with my pastime interest in blockchain. I’ve been dabbling in the blockchain space for the past 3 or so years in my free time. I’ve been riding the ups and downs, the pitfalls, and opportunities of this new technology and I’ve noticed that there is a lot of talk about crypto, NFTs, DAOs, etc. but very little connection to real-world impact.
 
It takes a long time to wrap your head around concepts, jargon, culture, and acronyms(!), in both Blockchain and Sustainability/Impact. I decided to work on bridging these themes. 

If you’re involved in Blockchain and are not sure what the difference between ESG and SDG is; or alternatively, if you’re involved in the Impact space and think that crypto is just destroying our environment and a big scam, I invite you to follow me on this journey as I bridge between these worlds. 
 
It’s humble beginnings, but I’ll be experimenting with small projects to exemplify how we can move past this nascent stage of blockchain (ape NFTs and meme coins) and move into more useful applications! I’ll be exploring what carbon markets look like when tokenized on DAOs, if NFTs can do more for the environment than take away from it, what does community building look like when it’s divorced from geography and identity, is crypto a more useful way to do philanthropy, and can we really “tokenize” impact?  
 
If all that sounds confusing yet intriguing, follow me on this journey through Twitter and my website!
https://lnkd.in/dKjG4N4h 
https://lnkd.in/dkQtrfEj 
#blockchain #environnement #technology  #sustainability #impact

Connecteam is hiring - *SEO Specialist*
Connecteam is a TLV-based startup that’s on a mission to change the work experience for 80% of the world’s global workforce - the deskless employees. 

We're looking for a highly talented, experienced, passionate, and data-driven SEO specialist to join our growing marketing team.

About this role:
As an SEO specialist at Connecteam, you will be responsible for planning, executing, and analyzing search engine optimization activities to drive the company’s organic growth efforts.

Ownership & responsibilities:
Conduct deep-dive analysis and keyword research to support Connecteam’s organic growth.
Work closely with the SEO Team on developing and implementing organic growth and optimization strategies.
Work closely with our creative & content team on planning, executing, optimizing, and analyzing content marketing activities
Conduct technical audits and deliver technical specs to other teams in order to support technical optimization of the company website.
Working with Sales, Customer Success, R&D, Product, and other teams to achieve marketing goals.
Identify trends and constantly come up with new growth opportunities
Optimizing conversion rates via examination and implementation of CRO strategies across our website.
Stay on top of the latest SEO tools, trends, and changes.
 
Qualifications:
3+ years of SEO experience with an international SaaS company (in-house).
Experience in planning and executing content marketing strategies.
Experienced in on-page optimization to boost organic growth.
Experience with conducting technical site audits.
SEO-related knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and experience with large-scale‌ ‌data‌ ‌analysis.
Excellent analytical skills, the ability to interpret data and trends along with meticulous attention to detail.
Proficiency in web analytics and SEO tools (Semrush, Ahrefs, Screaming Frog, etc.)
A team player with excellent written and oral communication skills.
Experience using WordPress.
“Can-do” and hands-on mentality, growth mindset, adaptability, and a drive for continuous improvement
Bachelor’s degree (BA/BS) in exact science, economics, industrial engineering marketing, business, or related fields
Ability to manage deadlines and prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment.
Fluent English.

Taking advantage of AI in sales featuring Bubble (part 2)

This app allows you to generate professional-grade sales decks that are customized per client. 

How it works?

1) Specify the problems that were raised by the client during the meeting, send an API call to Ghat GPT (that's been taught information about the product and the solutions it offers) and get a solution in seconds from AI. 

2) Input client's details and logo

3) Get a professional-looking PDF sales deck (based on a Google Slides template that can be designed by the product marketing)

איך מנהלים תקשורת פנים ארגונית באופן אפקטיבי? וכמה הדבר חיוני להצלחת הארגון?

איפה זה פוגש אותנו: 
✅ היכולת להגיע לאחרון העובדים בצורה אפקטיבית ורציפה
✅ היכולת לוודא שכל הארגון ראה וקרא את נוהל הבטיחות החדש
✅ היכולת להעביר הכשרת עובדים בזמן קצר והבנה מיטבית של החומר
✅  היכולת לשתף בקידום עובדים, ימי הולדת, שנים בחברה בצורה בה כולם יהיו חשופים לזה ויוכלו לחגוג יחד
✅ היכולת להיות בבעלות על המידע ולדעת שהוא מאובטח ומנוהל
✅ היכולת להפריד בין תקשורת אישית לתקשורת בענייני עבודה 
✅ היכולת להמנע מתביעות דיני עבודה סביב תקשורת שמתבצעת דרך הוואטסאפ

אלון רפאל, מנהל הפעילות העסקית של קונקטים בישראל, מסביר כיצד הדרך שבה מנהלים תקשורת פנים ארגונית קריטית להצלחת הארגון, ואיך אפליקציה ייעודית לתקשורת פנים ארגונית יכולה להיות הכלי הנכון!

🎧 אם אתם בעלי עסקים קטנים או גדולים או מנהלים בארגון, קחו 22 דקות להאזין לכתבת הפודקאסט המלאה שאולי תוכל להיות הדבר הכי טוב שקרה לארגון שלכם.

משתמשים באפליקציה לתקשורת פנים ארגונית?
שתפו בתגובות מה החשיבות והיתרונות עבור העסק שלכם! 👇
תייגו ושתפו כדי שיוכל להגיע לכל העסקים ♻

I met the Hanukkah miracle with help from Gvahim and Connecteam! I am a data analyst by profession and I know for sure that even in the virtual space everything has clear cause-and-effect relationships. But my first holiday of light in Israel refutes this fact. On December 20, at the invitation of Gvahim, I attended a working event for HI-TECH specialists organized by Connecteam. I am new to Israel and do not work in my specialty yet. And for me, the meeting now is even just meeting with colleagues and getting to know the new developing multifunctional product that Connecteam is producing is a great pleasure. Moreover, I found myself in a very friendly warm atmosphere, which is filled with a cool office. I heard such living human stories by Nathanel Creson, Chen Shofar, and Lev Kantor, who was born in Chelyabinsk, like my dad. Would anyone say that this is not a Hanukkah miracle? Many thanks to Asel Vinokurova, who sent me an invitation to this meeting. To all the Gvahim staff – Julia Rafalski, Sofya Gershman, Judith Wainshtain-Gros, who are so actively and productively helping the difficult process of absorption. חג חנוכה שמח!

It was a pleasure to host you guys!

⭐️Another Connecteam  sales department spotlight coming up ⭐️

This time it is Katya Zalevski! Katya joined us last October and has made a huge impact to the team so far 🔝
Due to that fact, she took on the important role of leading the learning and development of the entire department. 👏🏼

🔥How does it feel to receive extra responsibility at such an early stage of working at Connecteam ?
I didn't expect it. I knew all along that I wanted to take on new projects, once I was done refining my day-to-day after the onboarding, so I was surprised and intrigued by this new opportunity. It makes me feel so appreciated by the company, and this is something I hadn't experienced elsewhere.

🔥So what exactly is your new role in the sales team?
I'm responsible to make sure the whole sales team is qualified according to their seniority in the company and lead anybody in the department to personal and professional career development within Connecteam.  
Allowing anybody to find their personal passion in the sales department and express themselves in their own unique way.
On top of that, one of my responsibilities is meeting the department's knowledge accessible and available to everyone.

️🔥What does your daily routine look like?
Most of my clients are from North America therefore I'm start my day at noon, working on projects and making sure that everyone is progressing with their qualifications. Additionally, I'm working on new qualifications and courses for the team, to expand their knowledge.
Then, at around 4 pm, it's sales time! Reaching out to my clients, doing product demonstrations, and making sure I'm on top of my pipeline!

🔥Do you feel you have a big impact on the department?
It is amazing to know that every month, I open a new door for each of the employees in the department. I feel like my voice and opinions are really being heard and it is really exciting to be able to get so creative and passionate about something.

Give it up for Katya Zalevski !!! 

#sales #teambuilding #employeerecognition

🔥 Hey everyone welcome back! 🔥
So today we are going to continue to explain some more about what’s happening at Connecteam 's Sales team :)
Last time we mentioned the many sales roles that were handed out to our team members, today we are going to dive into the first →
Head of no-touch clients. So the spotlight turns to the one and only Yuval Rimon

⭐️How does it feel to receive extra responsibility at such an early stage of working at Connecteam?
The fact that I’m being trusted with such a serious responsibility at this early stage really makes me feel appreciated and that the leadership at Connecteam truly believes in me as a professional.

⭐️So what exactly is your new role in the sales team?
My role is head of our no-touch clients. Basically, we have clients who sign up to our platform and end up paying for Connecteam without actually having a direct Account manager. My role is to make sure they have all the answers they need in order to make the right decision on their own. 

⭐️What does your daily routine look like?
My daily routine usually splits into two parts - Working on the projects I’m in charge of: research, strategic planning, and meeting with the different personas across the company - And of course in the afternoon: Sales-Sales-Sales !

⭐️Do you feel you have a big impact on the department?
It certainly feels like I’m in a position to make a big change - In the field we’re in, moving the needle in the slightest can cause a massive effect on our revenue.
As much of a cliche as this might sound - I actually feel like I’m appreciated and “seen” not only for my hard work but for my potential as well, which to me - means everything.



#sales #team #leadership #tech #hightech
