I’m looking for a job in a multicultural and multilingual environment - my happy place :)

I’m interested in the fields of: 
* Internationalization

* Partnerships Management
* Project/Program Management
* Customer Success.

Most recently, I worked in the International Student Affairs Office at the Council for Higher Education of Israel where I was responsible for the branding and marketing efforts of the ‘Study in Israel’ initiative. I managed numerous flagship projects and collaborated across time zones with Israeli embassies, academic bodies, and various international organizations.

I am a native English speaker, tech-savvy, and meticulous in my work, bearing strong interpersonal and communication skills (written and verbal).

Any leads would be greatly appreciated!

I'm very pleased to share the second edition of the Israeli Academia magazine!

In cooperation with nine academic institutions, the magazine showcases the essence of Israeli academic excellence and the innovative research happening across the country. 

#sustinability #sustainabledevelopment

Last week I had the privilege to participate in a webinar organized by Think India, the Indo-Israel Study Group, and Study in Israel India Desk. 

Having graduated from The American Embassy School, New Delhi, I was especially excited to take part in this initiative. In the talk I presented an overview of Israeli academia and spoke about the many reasons why one should pursue higher education in Israel as an international student or researcher.

After being hosted so well in India for three life-changing years, I look forward to hosting them here in Israel!

#studyinisrael #engageinexcellence #studyabroad #highereducation

I had the incredible opportunity to build the 'Study in Israel' booth for #NAFSA - the largest international education event in the world. 

Thank you to Inbal Karo for your partnership and for turning the vision into reality, to Dalit Parsser for your mentorship, and to all the representatives of the Israeli HEIs who participated in the process and represented ‘Study in Israel’ wonderfully.

Think creatively, think critically, think actively, think Israel.

Study In Israel NAFSA: Association of International Educators

In English for my American friends. Please share. Stand with Israel!

The United States experienced the World Trade Center attack of 9/11 2001 as a huge crisis that was publicized all over the world and reverberated in its cruelty 
The exception. 

These were a series of unprecedented suicide attacks (using commercial planes!) that took place in the United States, and are considered to date the largest and deadliest terrorist attacks in the history of mankind.  

as well as the largest attack on American soil. 

These attacks led the United States and other countries to the Afghan War (2001-2014) and the global war on Islamic terrorism.

On September 11 2001, 2,977 people were directly killed.

In Israel, nearly 1,000 civilians have been killed so far. The vast majority of them are Israelis as of this moment.  I'm not talking about over 100 abductees who were kidnapped to Gaza.

Israel is 1/36 the size of the United States.

Take 1,000 dead, multiply by 36 and you get the relative equivalent of 36,000 dead, which is 12 times bigger than the 9/11 tragic events.

And we shall call this out to the world – and maybe then what happened to us in Israel last night will permeate everyone.

It's not "like Yom Kippur" because the world doesn't understand what Yom Kippur is. 

There is no benefit in talking about and write and interview about fights Israel had in the 70s or 60s in a world where the biggest media consumers are Millennials and Gen Zs.

The words are short to describe the feeling of cavity that gripped me and certainly everyone who watched the shocking photos and videos from the events of the last day.

These bastards murdered, raped, looted and did not spare the elderly, children, infants and women.

This is a war that has just begun, and we must be prepared for the future 
On all fronts. 

But it is our duty - to improve the narrative and how information is to be shared.

Truth be told:

The events of October 7, 2023 in Israel are Israel’s - 9/11. And it's 12 times bigger than that. 

And that makes last night's events the greatest terrorist event humanity has ever known.

החברה שהתנהלה במשך 7 שנים עם 2.5$ מיליון, כיום סך הגיוסים שלה עומד על 160$ מיליון. 

השבוע בפודקאסט גיא קצוביץ' מארח את אמיר נחמיה, מנכ"ל ומייסד-שותף של Connecteam  (קונקטים).

קונקטים מפתחת פלטפורמה פנים ארגונית לניהול ותפעול עובדים עבור חברות שמרבית עובדיהן אינם נגישים למייל ולמחשב ארגוני ומהווים כ-80% משוק העבודה העולמי. 

החברה נוסדה ב-2015 ומשרתת מעל ל-20,000 לקוחות בכ-80 מדינות: ישראל, מדינות באירופה ובצפון אמריקה. 

בין לקוחות החברה ניתן למצוא חברות קטנות של כ-5 עובדים וחברות גדולות ובינלאומיות דוגמת סודהסטרים, תנובה, ישרוטל, פוקס, נייקי, yes, Sodexo, מקורות ועוד. 

לאחרונה גייסה החברה 120 מיליון דולר בסבב C, מה שהביא אותה לשווי גיוסים כולל של 160 מיליון דולר. 

אמיר שירת כחובל בצוללות במשך 7 שנים ובתפקידו האחרון שימש כראש מדור אמצעי לחימה של הצוללות (אפיון ורכש של אמצעי לחימה ותקשורת). 

לאחר שחרורו סיים תואר שני והצטרף לסטארטאפ גיימינג כפיתוח עסקי. לאחר מספר פיבוטים הקים בשנת 2015 את קונקטים עם יונתן נוריאל ודניאל נוריאל.

בפרק אמיר משתף בדרך הלא פשוטה שעבר משלב הרעיון ("איך למכור מוצר תוכנה לאנשים שלא יודעים מהי תוכנה?"), הטעויות שעשו (״הגענו לשלב שסגרנו את המשרדים, חזרנו לעבוד מהדירה ופיטרנו את העובדים") ועד ההצלחה. 

קישורים בתגובה הראשונה, האזנה נעימה!

maheen-kanwal.postDetails:
Listen

In a world abuzz with noise,
Where words rush like a flowing tide,
True listening stands as a sacred choice,
A sanctuary where hearts reside.

Listening isn't just about absorbing sounds,
It's about diving deep, exploring grounds.

Most listen to reply, their thoughts ablaze,
Eager to share their own, in a hurried haze.
But true listening pauses, takes a breath,
To grasp the essence, beyond the surface's depth.

Listening with empathy, a gift so rare,
A soothing balm, a healing prayer.

Listening, a simple act, yet profound,
A love that heals, without a sound.
So, when someone seeks to share their soul,
Listen with empathy, let your spirit unfold.


Disclaimer: Produced by Bard. I was prompting it for something totally different, but it created a poem instead.

I'm not a poetic person but I liked this one, so I shared. 😊
Listen to understand, not reply.

#empathy #listening #understanding #care #motivation

What's your excuse of not posting on LinkedIn?


- Are you afraid of putting yourself out there? 
- Do you think you don't have anything interesting to say? 
- Or are you simply too busy to add another thing to your plate?


If any of these excuses sound familiar, 
I'm here to tell you that you're missing out on a significant opportunity to put yourself in front of 𝟏 𝐛𝐢𝐥𝐥𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐩𝐞𝐨𝐩𝐥𝐞. 

That's right. 


▪️Start small. Even a short update or thought-provoking question.
▪️Share what are you passionate about.
▪️Tell what are you good at. Share your knowledge.
▪️Any challenge you faced and then overcame
▪️Don't just post & disappear. Comment on others' posts, 
▪️participate in discussions, show that you're interested in connecting
▪️Be consistent. The more you post, the more visible you'll become.


If you're still hesitant, let me ask you this: 


𝘄𝗵𝗮𝘁'𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝘄𝗼𝗿𝘀𝘁 𝘁𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗰𝗼𝘂𝗹𝗱 𝗵𝗮𝗽𝗽𝗲𝗻?
- You might get a few comments or likes. Or, 
- you might make a valuable connection that could lead to new opportunities.


So, what are you waiting for? Start posting on LinkedIn today and start taking advantage of all it has to offer.


📌And if you don't have time or don't know where or how to start, 

- Let's talk. We'll come up with a plan to 
- build an impactful LinkedIn presence that will 
- help you achieve your professional goals.

DM “Linkedin” and let's get started.

#LinkedIn #SocialMedia #CareerGrowth #ProfessionalDevelopment #linkedingowth #linkedincreators #personalbrandingtips

LinkedIn is punishing you for these 6 sins, with slashed reach & engagement⚠️


• Resharing content
• Sharing external links: Especially those with previews.
• Editing posts within 30 minutes: Can reduce visibility.
• Being the first to comment: Avoid on your own post.
• Tagging too many people: Especially non-engagers.
• Posting too frequently: Wait at least 18 hours between posts.
• Long posts over 1600 characters


🎖️Rewards for:

• Compelling hook that prompts users to click “see more.”
• Optimizing engagement within the first 90 minutes: Encourage friends to engage.
• An actionable CTA that promotes discussion.
• Replying to comments: Interact within the first 90 minutes.


What else have you observed about the Mighty LinkedIn algo?

My impressions are down by 70% lately, even though I've gained many followers in last couple of weeks. 🥺


Note: observations are based on individual experimentation and some LI reports.


#algorithmupdates #linkedingrowth #linkedinengagement #linkedincreators

How ChatGPT helped me with the 'content mix' strategy for a CEO's LinkedIn Profile.


So, I'm not the team "anti" ChatGPT. 
I actually use it for various use cases.


I planned the whole "Pillar" and "Posts" strategy 
but wasn't sure on how many pillars should I 
cover each week/month?


➜1 pillar - would become boring
➜ 2-3 pillars: sweet spot to show diversity & expertise in different areas.


So, I fed all the info to ChatGPT and asked for suggestions.


Results:

- Weekly Content Breakdown
- Types of posts (mix: educational, interactive, personal insights, company news)
- Seasonal or trending topics
- Recurring theme (so audience knows 'when' to expect 'what' from you)
- Audience engagement
- Quarterly review (what's working, what's not)


It involved a lot of prompting, but I'm happy with the suggestions.
Would give me a good starting point.


❓Tell me, do you use ChatGPT regularly? For what purposes?


PS. If you need my help with your LinkedIn Profile Optimization or even producing quality content, DM 'LinkedIn' and let's get started. 😊

#linkedinstrategy #socialmediastrategy #audienceengagement #linkedingrowth #personalbranding #ghostwriting #copywriting

We all talk about LinkedIn algorithm, but do you know our brain also has an algo that mirrors LinkedIn's?


Here's how LinkedIn algo works:

- tailor feed based on interactions
- prioritizes relevance& personal interest
- changes with changing preferences

And our brain algo:

- processes the info we consume
- shapes our beliefs & thought patterns
- adapts based on new experiences & learnings

🔴Positive inputs ➜ optimistic outlook + success
🟢Negative inputs ➜ self-doubt + hindered growth


You need to take control & optimize your mental algo:

☘️Embrace gratitude
☘️Counter negative thoughts
☘️Actively seek positive content
☘️Engage with inspiring ideas & peers

Positive mindset ➜ fulfilling life

Choose what you feed wisely!


#linkedinalgorithm #brainscience #affirmation #thoughts #growthmindset

6 hidden costs of building a personal brand no one talks about


While personal branding is rewarding,
There's a flip side that often goes unspoken


Pressure to always be 'on' & creating ➜burnout
Investing heavily in tools ➜ financial strain
Constant need for validation ➜ addiction
Doubting yourself ➜imposter syndrome
Long hours working solo ➜loneliness

Don't lose yourself; do this instead✅

Draw boundaries to protect your time& energy.
Accept your doubts as part of the journey.
Be selective about what you share.
Create a schedule & stick to it.
Build a support network.
Spend smartly.

GPTs are the talk of the town these days, 
but what about their hidden security risks? 🛑

often containing sensitive information.

🔺Unintentional leaks of proprietary info
🔺Bias and ethical concerns
🔺confidential data leakage
🔺Model vulnerabilities
🔺identity thefts

Take precautions🛡️

✅ Prioritize ethical considerations.
✅ Carefully select your training data.
✅ Restrict access to authorized people.
✅  Implement robust security measures.
✅ Regularly test for vulnerabilities, apply security patches.


❓ Have you been experimenting with GPTs and feeding your data for analysis?

Ever scrolled past a post because it was too dense? 
Your audience might do the same.

Visibility is key on LinkedIn. And the secret to visibility? 
Formatting.


𝐆𝐫𝐞𝐚𝐭 𝐌𝐞𝐬𝐬𝐚𝐠𝐞 + 𝐆𝐫𝐞𝐚𝐭 𝐑𝐞𝐚𝐝𝐚𝐛𝐢𝐥𝐢𝐭𝐲 = 𝐆𝐫𝐞𝐚𝐭 𝐔𝐧𝐝𝐞𝐫𝐬𝐭𝐚𝐧𝐝𝐢𝐧𝐠


Here's how top LinkedIn creators, like Jasmin Alić format their posts for readability:

1. Use listicles to explain steps
2. Use numbers instead of bullets
3. Write as one-liners to keep it snappy
4. Golden rule for paragraph: 3 lines or less
5. Balance the length – uniformity is appealing
6. Short hooks = More engagement; best 1-liners
7. Seal the deal with a 3-line summary; ideal 1-liner CTA

Make it readable. Make it memorable. Make it matter.

♻️Repost if useful.

Share your experiences or your favorite formatting hack in the comments below!

It's natural to
- feel the urge to respond instantly, 
- to act on every impulse, and 
- to provide solutions to every challenge thrown our way.


Sometimes, the best action is inaction. 


➜ PAUSE. Take a deep breath. Count to 10.
➜ Ask Yourself: Is this a crisis or just a challenge? 
  ↳ Differentiate urgency from importance. 
➜ Sometimes, people need an ear, not a solution.  
   ↳ Hear them out. 

➜ Things find a way. Your intervention isn’t always needed. 
➜ It’s okay to say no. Choose where to invest your time wisely. 
➜ Understand that there are situations beyond your control.


𝗡𝗲𝘅𝘁 𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗲 𝘆𝗼𝘂'𝗿𝗲 𝗳𝗮𝗰𝗲𝗱 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵 𝗮 "𝗻𝗼𝘄",
→ jot down your initial reaction. 
→ Wait an hour, then come back to it. 
→ Reflect on whether your immediate "how" was truly necessary.


Embrace the mystery, enjoy the journey! 🙌🏼


❓Tell me, are you someone who can't live without planning every little detail or do you embrace the uncertainty? 



#letitbe #embrace #uncertainty #motivation #life #linkedincreators #writing #writer

FeedBACK vs FeedFORWARD

The approach you choose can redefine your perspective.

▪️ Feedback offers a retrospective view, much like glancing in the rearview mirror.

• What we did
• What went well
• Areas for improvement
• Facilitates learning from experience
• Can sometimes trigger defensive reactions. 

▪️ Feedforward provides a proactive guide, akin to a GPS offering direction.

• Emphasizes development
• Enhances future performance
• Encourages proactive preparation
• Can be motivating and empowering
• Creates positive environment & open communication


Both approaches have their place in personal and professional growth.

For instance:

👉🏻 A manager might offer feedback on an employee’s recent project performance, highlighting strengths and areas for improvement.

👉🏻 Following that, they could provide feedforward by outlining specific actions the employee can take to excel in upcoming tasks or projects.


❓ Which approach resonates with you the most?


Inspired by Ashley Faus Post 🙌🏼😊


#feedback #feedforward #constructivefeedback #improvement #growth #continuouslearning #linkedincreators

Do you know men also get breast cancer? 😲


Yes, you read that right.
It seems like it doesn't discriminate based on gender.


While it's much less common than in women, men are not immune to this devastating disease. Due to a lack of awareness, men are often diagnosed at a more advanced stage.

🌸 𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗰𝗮𝗻 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝗱𝗼?

- See if you have a family history of breast or ovarian cancer.
- Learn to recognize unusual lumps or changes in the chest area.
- If you notice any abnormalities, see a doctor promptly. Early detection is crucial.


🎗️Let's make a promise to ourselves and our loved ones. 
A promise to be aware, to be supportive, and to 
Never underestimate the power of early detection.

Ever wondered why you value things more once you own them? 


- Felt inclined to buy after a free sample🍦?
- Those loyalty reward points you're hoarding?
- Customized your sneakers?👟


It's not just you; 

it's the "Endowment Effect" at play! 

It's a cognitive bias or mind trick where we value things more simply because we own them.

👉🏻How to use it in Copywriting?

• Teasers
• Offer free samples
• Personalize proposals
• Share exclusive content previews
• Showcase testimonials and portfolios
• Conduct interactive workshops for value
• Highlight potential losses to trigger urgency.

Add the endowment effect into your strategies, and watch your engagement soar!🔥

What is "𝗰𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗻𝘁 𝗮𝘁𝗼𝗺𝗶𝘇𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻"? ⚛️

Popular brands like Nike, RedBull, TED are doing it!

It's a process of breaking down an existing piece of content into shorter, 𝐛𝐢𝐭𝐞-𝐬𝐢𝐳𝐞𝐝 pieces.

▪️long blog post ➜ series of social media posts (HubSpot)
▪️video tutorial ➜ series of shorter clips (TED talks)
▪️ebook ➜ series of email courses 
▪️webinar ➜ infographics/video clips
▪️TV commercials ➜ GIFs, social posts (Coca-Cola)

This can be done for many reasons, such as 

🥢 to reach a wider audience,
🥢 to make content more shareable on social media
🥢 to make it easier to consume on mobile devices, 
🥢 or to make it more accessible to people with shorter attention spans.


❓ 𝗜𝘀𝗻'𝘁 𝗶𝘁 𝘀𝗮𝗺𝗲 𝗮𝘀 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗻𝘁 𝗿𝗲𝗽𝘂𝗿𝗽𝗼𝘀𝗶𝗻𝗴? You may ask.

Well, yes and no.

✔️While both aim to extend the lifespan and reach of existing content

▪️𝐀𝐭𝐨𝐦𝐢𝐳𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 focuses on breaking content down into smaller components for dissemination.

▪️𝐑𝐞𝐩𝐮𝐫𝐩𝐨𝐬𝐢𝐧𝐠 involves adapting content into different formats or for different platforms to reach a wider audience.


𝗥𝗲𝗮𝗱𝘆 𝘁𝗼 𝗮𝗺𝗽𝗹𝗶𝗳𝘆 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗻𝘁'𝘀 𝗶𝗺𝗽𝗮𝗰𝘁 𝘁𝗵𝗿𝗼𝘂𝗴𝗵 𝗮𝘁𝗼𝗺𝗶𝘇𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗿𝗲𝗽𝘂𝗿𝗽𝗼𝘀𝗶𝗻𝗴? 𝗚𝗲𝘁 𝗶𝗻 𝘁𝗼𝘂𝗰𝗵 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵 𝗺𝗲 𝘁𝗼𝗱𝗮𝘆.

Ditch the weak adverbs for stronger verbs to craft powerful narratives💪🏻

Here's how:

👉 Weak: He walked quietly.
✨ Strong: He tip-toed.

👉The speaker spoke clearly.
✨ The speaker articulated her points with precision.

👉 He talked quietly
✨ He whispered.

👉 She ran quickly.
✨ She sprinted.

Weak adverbs cause:
♦️Ambiguity
♦️Redundancy
♦️Weak impact
♦️Lack of specificity
♦️Lack of engagement
♦️Natural flow disruption

Stronger verbs provide:
❇️Clarity
❇️Emphasis
❇️Immediacy
❇️Authenticity
❇️Conciseness
❇️Engagement
❇️Memorability

Remember, balance is key! 

While adverbs have their place, using them judiciously and opting for strong verbs can greatly enhance the quality of your writing.

Bill Gates doesn't value money!



That was the opinion of a chef from popular Michelin-Star Restaurant

Why?

Some time ago, Gates booked the entire Michelin-star restaurant in Barcelona for two days.

Known for its extravagant dishes, the restaurant boasts a tasting menu costing $313 per person.

They had prepared the best and biggest for him and his team.

𝗔𝗻𝗱 𝗱𝗼 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝗸𝗻𝗼𝘄 𝘄𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗕𝗶𝗹𝗹 𝗱𝗶𝗱? 

He ordered a 𝗗𝗶𝗲𝘁 𝗖𝗼𝗸𝗲 and went back to his plane. Not even a single bite.

"𝙏𝙝𝙚𝙧𝙚 𝙖𝙧𝙚 𝙥𝙚𝙤𝙥𝙡𝙚 𝙬𝙝𝙤 𝙝𝙖𝙫𝙚 𝙢𝙤𝙣𝙚𝙮; 𝙩𝙝𝙚𝙮'𝙧𝙚 𝙖 𝙗𝙞𝙩 𝙩𝙞𝙧𝙚𝙙 𝙤𝙛 𝙚𝙫𝙚𝙧𝙮𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙣𝙜. 𝙏𝙝𝙚𝙮 𝙫𝙖𝙡𝙪𝙚 𝙩𝙝𝙞𝙣𝙜𝙨 𝙡𝙚𝙨𝙨," Chef expressed his opinion.

Was he right? Well, no.



We often associate immense wealth with extravagant lifestyles, but not all billionaires fit that mold. 

Bill Gates, the co-founder of Microsoft and one of the world's wealthiest individuals, offers us a refreshing perspective on money and life.

💡 𝗟𝗲𝘀𝘀𝗼𝗻 𝗶𝗻 𝗦𝗶𝗺𝗽𝗹𝗶𝗰𝗶𝘁𝘆 & 𝗣𝗵𝗶𝗹𝗮𝗻𝘁𝗵𝗿𝗼𝗽𝗶𝗰 𝗖𝗼𝗺𝗺𝗶𝘁𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁 🌏
• Wealth doesn't dictate personal values or preferences.
• He values wealth as a means to make a positive impact on the world.
• Simplicity in lifestyle and diet can be a conscious choice, even for billionaires.
  
• 𝗧𝗿𝘂𝗲 𝗹𝗲𝗮𝗱𝗲𝗿𝘀 𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝗱𝗲𝗳𝗶𝗻𝗲𝗱 𝗯𝘆 𝘁𝗵𝗲𝗶𝗿 𝗽𝗲𝗿𝘀𝗼𝗻𝗮𝗹 𝗯𝗿𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗶𝗺𝗽𝗮𝗰𝘁 𝘁𝗵𝗲𝘆 𝗰𝗿𝗲𝗮𝘁𝗲, 𝗻𝗼𝘁 𝗯𝘆 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗹𝘂𝘅𝘂𝗿𝗶𝗼𝘂𝘀 𝗯𝗿𝗮𝗻𝗱𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲𝘆 𝘄𝗲𝗮𝗿, 𝗱𝗿𝗶𝘃𝗲, 𝗼𝗿 𝗲𝗮𝘁.

Instead of making sweeping judgments, change your perspective.

In a world often preoccupied with materialism, Bill Gates reminds us that simplicity and a commitment to philanthropy define a person's true wealth and legacy. 💪

Ever visited a website that took ages to load?

Sounds frustrating, right?

This drives your potential customers to competitors with faster, more responsive sites.

Do the following to improve web loading speed and attract potential leads:

1. Use smaller image sizes.
2. Use a good hosting service.
3. Only show important stuff first.
4. Make your website files smaller.
5. Don't use too many fancy add-ons.
6. Reduce the number of things on your page.
7. Make sure your website works well on phones.
8. Reduce the use of third-party scripts and plugins.
9. Keep an eye on how your website is doing with tools like Google PageSpeed Insights.

3. 𝗖𝗼𝗻𝗻𝗲𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 with like-minded people for support
4. 𝗕𝗿𝗲𝗮𝗸𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗯𝗶𝗴 𝗴𝗼𝗮𝗹𝘀 into realistic milestones 
5. Giving 𝘀𝗲𝗹𝗳 𝗽𝗲𝗽-𝘁𝗮𝗹𝗸; 
  (weighing positives against the negatives and practicing gratitude.)

Don't be so hard on yourself.

𝗘𝘃𝗲𝗿 𝗰𝗮𝗺𝗲 𝗮𝗰𝗿𝗼𝘀𝘀 𝘄𝗼𝗿𝗱𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗺𝗮𝗸𝗲 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝗿𝗼𝗹𝗹 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗲𝘆𝗲𝘀 𝘀𝗼 𝗵𝗮𝗿𝗱 𝘁𝗵𝗲𝘆 𝗺𝗶𝗴𝗵𝘁 𝗷𝘂𝘀𝘁 𝗳𝗮𝗹𝗹 𝗼𝘂𝘁? 🙄

I'm talking about buzzwords like
• state-of-the-art
• revolutionary
• cutting-edge
• innovative
• unleash
• synergy
🥱🥱😴😴

While they might sound impressive, they're more likely to put people to sleep than get them excited.

Instead, imagine having a friendly chat with your favorite neighbor. 

You wouldn't throw in complex words just to show off, right? 

Same goes for your copy! Speak like you're having a cozy chat over coffee. 

𝗦𝗶𝗺𝗽𝗹𝗲 𝘄𝗼𝗿𝗱𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗲𝘃𝗲𝗿𝘆𝗼𝗻𝗲 𝘂𝗻𝗱𝗲𝗿𝘀𝘁𝗮𝗻𝗱𝘀 𝗸𝗲𝗲𝗽 𝘁𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗴𝘀 𝗿𝗲𝗹𝗮𝘁𝗮𝗯𝗹𝗲 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗲𝗻𝗴𝗮𝗴𝗶𝗻𝗴.

🤝Connect with people, not confuse them. 

So, when crafting your copy, opt for 𝗰𝗹𝗲𝗮𝗿, 𝗲𝘃𝗲𝗿𝘆𝗱𝗮𝘆 𝗹𝗮𝗻𝗴𝘂𝗮𝗴𝗲 that paints a picture. 

Think about the 𝗳𝗲𝗲𝗹𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝘄𝗮𝗻𝘁 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗿𝗲𝗮𝗱𝗲𝗿𝘀 𝘁𝗼 𝗵𝗮𝘃𝗲—and use words that bring that feeling to life.

❌Instead of: "Our cutting-edge technology revolutionizes the industry."
❇️Try: "Our new tech makes things way easier for you. No more headaches!"

❌Instead of: "Experience unparalleled synergy with our integrated solutions."
❇️Try: "Our solutions work together like peanut butter and jelly—a perfect match!"

❌Instead of: "Innovative AI-driven algorithms optimize your workflow."
❇️Try: "Our smart AI helps you get things done faster and smarter."

❌Instead of: "Our platform offers paradigm-shifting insights."
❇️Try: "Get ready for some 'aha' moments—our platform spills the beans!"

❌Instead of: "Our state-of-the-art design enhances user engagement."
❇️Try: "Our sleek design makes sure folks stick around and enjoy the ride."

See how these examples use 𝘀𝘁𝗿𝗮𝗶𝗴𝗵𝘁𝗳𝗼𝗿𝘄𝗮𝗿𝗱 𝗹𝗮𝗻𝗴𝘂𝗮𝗴𝗲 that anyone can grasp? 

The aim is to make your message crystal clear, so your audience knows exactly what you're offering and why it's awesome. No dictionary required! 😉

✉️ Looking for a copy that's clear and engaging, rather than just clever, to effectively reach your audience? Feel free to drop me a DM!

𝗗𝗼'𝘀 & 𝗗𝗼𝗻'𝘁𝘀: 𝟳 𝗔𝗹𝘁𝗲𝗿𝗻𝗮𝘁𝗶𝘃𝗲𝘀 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗖𝗿𝗮𝗳𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗠𝗮𝗴𝗻𝗲𝘁𝗶𝗰 𝗛𝗼𝗼𝗸𝘀

The goal of a hook is not just to grab attention, but also to draw the reader in and make them curious to learn more. 

Whether you're using a question, a surprising fact, or a compelling statistic, always aim to pique your reader's curiosity and make your content feel relevant and engaging.

❌ Instead of a 𝘣𝘳𝘰𝘢𝘥, 𝘶𝘯𝘲𝘶𝘢𝘯𝘵𝘪𝘧𝘪𝘦𝘥 𝘴𝘵𝘢𝘵𝘦𝘮𝘦𝘯𝘵 like, "Many people use social media every day,"
✅ 𝗨𝘀𝗲 𝘀𝗽𝗲𝗰𝗶𝗳𝗶𝗰 𝗻𝘂𝗺𝗯𝗲𝗿𝘀 to make your point more compelling, like, "With over 3.6 billion people using social media daily, it's more than a trend - it's a lifestyle revolution."

❌ Instead of asking a 𝘤𝘭𝘰𝘴𝘦𝘥-𝘦𝘯𝘥𝘦𝘥 𝘲𝘶𝘦𝘴𝘵𝘪𝘰𝘯 like, "Do you like coffee?"
✅ 𝗔𝘀𝗸 𝗮𝗻 𝗼𝗽𝗲𝗻-𝗲𝗻𝗱𝗲𝗱 𝗾𝘂𝗲𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 with a numerical element like, "If you could have coffee with any of the world's greatest thinkers, living or dead, who would be your top three choices?"

❌ Instead of asking 𝘨𝘦𝘯𝘦𝘳𝘪𝘤 𝘲𝘶𝘦𝘴𝘵𝘪𝘰𝘯𝘴, "Do you exercise often?"
✅ 𝗣𝗼𝘀𝗲 𝗮 𝗺𝗼𝗿𝗲 𝗶𝗻𝘁𝗿𝗶𝗴𝘂𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗾𝘂𝗲𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵 𝗻𝘂𝗺𝗯𝗲𝗿𝘀, such as, "If you knew that just 30 minutes of exercise a day could lower your risk of heart disease by up to 30%, would you change your daily routine?"

❌Instead of opening with a 𝘴𝘵𝘢𝘵𝘦𝘮𝘦𝘯𝘵 𝘵𝘩𝘢𝘵 𝘮𝘪𝘨𝘩𝘵 𝘯𝘰𝘵 𝘳𝘦𝘴𝘰𝘯𝘢𝘵𝘦 with everyone: "Running a marathon is the most rewarding experience."
✅𝗢𝗽𝗲𝗻 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵 𝗮 𝗺𝗼𝗿𝗲 𝘂𝗻𝗶𝘃𝗲𝗿𝘀𝗮𝗹𝗹𝘆 𝗿𝗲𝗹𝗮𝘁𝗮𝗯𝗹𝗲 𝘀𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗲𝗻𝘁: "The feeling of accomplishing a goal you've worked hard for is unmatched."

❌Instead of using a 𝘣𝘭𝘢𝘯𝘥 𝘥𝘦𝘴𝘤𝘳𝘪𝘱𝘵𝘪𝘰𝘯: "The park was full of trees and people were enjoying their day."
✅𝗣𝗮𝗶𝗻𝘁 𝗮 𝗺𝗼𝗿𝗲 𝘃𝗶𝘃𝗶𝗱 𝗽𝗶𝗰𝘁𝘂𝗿𝗲: "Under a canopy of lush green, families were laughing, savoring the scent of blooming flowers and the joyful notes of a nearby street performer."

❌Instead of sharing 𝘰𝘷𝘦𝘳𝘭𝘺 𝘱𝘦𝘳𝘴𝘰𝘯𝘢𝘭 𝘰𝘳 𝘪𝘳𝘳𝘦𝘭𝘦𝘷𝘢𝘯𝘵 𝘢𝘯𝘦𝘤𝘥𝘰𝘵𝘦𝘴. Example: "I ate toast for breakfast this morning."
✅𝗗𝗿𝗮𝘄 𝗼𝗻 𝗮 𝗿𝗲𝗹𝗲𝘃𝗮𝗻𝘁 𝗽𝗲𝗿𝘀𝗼𝗻𝗮𝗹 𝗮𝗻𝗲𝗰𝗱𝗼𝘁𝗲. Example: "The first time I jumped out of an airplane, my parachute didn't open."

❌ Instead of a 𝘷𝘢𝘨𝘶𝘦 𝘴𝘵𝘢𝘵𝘦𝘮𝘦𝘯𝘵 like, "A lot of people read books,"
✅ 𝗨𝘀𝗲 𝗮 𝘀𝗽𝗲𝗰𝗶𝗳𝗶𝗰 𝘀𝘁𝗮𝘁𝗶𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗰 such as, "Did you know that 27% of adults in the US haven't read a single book in the past year?"

What else?

CTVs tell the users what they will get for taking action. They help you

• improve customer understanding
• increase the conversion rate of your CTAs
• create stronger brand messaging & lasting impression
• enhance user experience UX on websites, landing pages
• reduce bounce rates, as users are clear on what they do next

💡𝙎𝙤𝙢𝙚 𝙩𝙞𝙥𝙨 𝙛𝙤𝙧 𝙢𝙖𝙠𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙮𝙤𝙪𝙧 𝘾𝙏𝘼 𝙚𝙛𝙛𝙚𝙘𝙩𝙞𝙫𝙚:

• 𝗞𝗲𝗲𝗽 𝗶𝘁 𝘀𝗵𝗼𝗿𝘁 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝘀𝗶𝗺𝗽𝗹𝗲. Your CTA should be easy to understand and remember.
• 𝗨𝘀𝗲 𝘀𝘁𝗿𝗼𝗻𝗴 𝗮𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 𝘃𝗲𝗿𝗯𝘀. Tell users exactly what you want them to do.
• 𝗕𝗲 𝘀𝗽𝗲𝗰𝗶𝗳𝗶𝗰 𝗮𝗯𝗼𝘂𝘁 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝘃𝗮𝗹𝘂𝗲 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗽𝗼𝘀𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻. What will users get in return for taking action?
• 𝗨𝘀𝗲 𝗽𝗲𝗿𝘀𝘂𝗮𝘀𝗶𝘃𝗲 𝗹𝗮𝗻𝗴𝘂𝗮𝗴𝗲. Make your CTA sound urgent and exciting.
• 𝗣𝗹𝗮𝗰𝗲 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗖𝗧𝗔 𝗶𝗻 𝗮 𝗽𝗿𝗼𝗺𝗶𝗻𝗲𝗻𝘁 𝗹𝗼𝗰𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻. Make sure users can easily find it.

6 quick copywriting tips that'll help you become a better writer in 6 minutes or less

By Email Marketing Guru Chase Dimond 💡

💜 Switch technical terms for benefits
💜 Make your Calls-to-action specific
💜 Stop being vague
💜 Start your sentences with transition words
💜 Sell with your own story
💜 Change your Call-to-actions to a Call-to-values.

♻️Repost & Follow for more. 😊


#copywritingtips #contentwriting #contentmarketingtips #copywriter

✂️𝟳 𝘁𝗶𝗽𝘀 𝗰𝘂𝘁 𝘁𝗼 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗰𝗵𝗮𝘀𝗲 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵 𝗳𝗹𝘂𝗳𝗳-𝗳𝗿𝗲𝗲 𝘄𝗿𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴✂️

🔹𝗚𝗲𝘁 𝗿𝗶𝗱 𝗼𝗳 "𝘁𝗵𝗮𝘁": That's right, eliminate this overused word. It's that simple!

❌"He said that he would complete the task by tomorrow."
✅"He said he would complete the task by tomorrow."

🔹𝗖𝘂𝘁 𝘁𝗵𝗲 "𝘃𝗲𝗿𝘆": Very tired of excessive adverbs? Trim them to make your writing shine!

❌"The project was a very big success."
✅"The project was a significant success."

🔹𝗦𝗮𝘆 𝗴𝗼𝗼𝗱𝗯𝘆𝗲 𝘁𝗼 "𝗶𝗻 𝗼𝗿𝗱𝗲𝗿 𝘁𝗼": Simplify your sentences by replacing this wordy phrase with just "to."

❌ "In order to achieve success, it is necessary to work hard and stay committed."
✅"To succeed, work hard and stay committed."

🔹𝗗𝗼𝗻'𝘁 𝗲𝘅𝗮𝗴𝗴𝗲𝗿𝗮𝘁𝗲: Avoid going overboard with hyperboles. Your writing will be stronger without them!

❌"Our product is the most amazing invention of the century!"
✅"Our product is an innovative invention."

🔹𝗕𝗲𝘄𝗮𝗿𝗲 𝗼𝗳 𝗿𝗲𝗱𝘂𝗻𝗱𝗮𝗻𝗰𝘆: Double-check your writing for unnecessary repetition. It's redundant and a waste of space!

❌"She personally greeted each and every guest."
✅"She personally greeted every guest."

🔹𝗦𝗵𝘂𝗻 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗷𝗮𝗿𝗴𝗼𝗻: Remember, not everyone is fluent in industry buzzwords. Be clear and inclusive.

❌"We leverage synergistic solutions to optimize cross-functional collaboration."
✅"We use effective strategies to improve teamwork across departments."

🔹𝗗𝗶𝘁𝗰𝗵 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗹𝗼𝗻𝗴 𝘀𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗻𝗰𝗲𝘀: Break them down into shorter, punchier ones. Your readers will thank you!

❌"Utilizing our cutting-edge technology, we are able to optimize efficiency to a very high degree."
✅ "Our technology maximizes efficiency."

Remember, 𝗯𝗿𝗲𝘃𝗶𝘁𝘆 𝗶𝘀 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝘀𝗼𝘂𝗹 𝗼𝗳 𝗰𝗹𝗮𝗿𝗶𝘁𝘆! Cut the fluff and make your writing pop!

#WritingTips #FluffFreeWriting #contentwriting #copywriting  

👇 Let's hear your tips for eliminating fluff in the comments below! 👇

📩 Need fluff-free writing? Shoot a DM 😊

Thinking, Research time>>>>>> actual Writing

You're leaving good money on the table if you don't take "thinking" into account.


#Copywriting #contentwriting #timemanagementtips

𝗗𝗼𝗻'𝘁 𝗴𝗶𝘃𝗲 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝟭𝟬𝟬%; 𝗴𝗶𝘃𝗲 𝟴𝟱%!

Seriously! That's what most successful leaders are doing!🔑💰

❌maximum effort ≠ maximum results; Reach for the "𝗢𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗮𝗹"

It might sound great for a pep-talk, but it leads to 𝘀𝘁𝗿𝗲𝘀𝘀 & 𝗯𝘂𝗿𝗻𝗼𝘂𝘁 - HBR Research

✅Instead, go for 85% to get optimal results!

• Pace yourself like a sprinter. 𝗗𝗼𝗻'𝘁 𝗯𝘂𝗿𝗻 𝗼𝘂𝘁 𝗯𝘆 𝗴𝗼𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗮𝗹𝗹 𝗼𝘂𝘁 𝘁𝗼𝗼 𝘀𝗼𝗼𝗻. Save some energy for the long run. 🏃‍♀️
  
• 𝗟𝗲𝗮𝘃𝗲 𝘀𝗹𝗮𝗰𝗸 𝗶𝗻 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝘀𝗰𝗵𝗲𝗱𝘂𝗹𝗲. Embrace flexibility and resilience to tackle the unexpected and achieve more overall. ⏰

💼 What does this mean for business leaders?

• Set a "𝗱𝗼𝗻𝗲-𝗳𝗼𝗿-𝘁𝗵𝗲-𝗱𝗮𝘆" time. Work smarter, not harder. ⏳

• Encourage 85% effort in your teams. It leads to better outcomes and avoids burnout. 🙌

• Watch out for high-pressure language like "ASAP" and "urgent." Embrace a balanced approach instead. ⚖️

Giving it your all may not be as effective as it sounds. 💡

Balance, resilience, and optimal effort are the keys to unlocking peak performance. 🗝️

#productivity #optimalperformance #business  #leaders #strategy #burnout

Ever been in a meeting that made you think "This could've been an email" 🙄😒

Well, you're not alone. Many of us have sailed the same boat. 🚣🏻

🗳Even a survey by Microsoft 365 shows that inefficient meetings are the biggest productivity disruptor in the workplace; followed by too many meetings.

But meeting FOMO is real.😬 People don't wanna miss out on the important discussions.

That's why companies need to radically rethink their strategy.

✅Schedule a meeting when absolutely necessary like 

🔷When brainstorming or problem solving is required
🔷Involves planning & Decision making
🔷Participation from various departments is needed

💡Think of meetings as a digital artifact and not just a point in time. Make things easier and more accessible for employees by leveraging AI-powered 

🎙intelligent meeting recaps, 
📝transcripts, and 
🎦recordings 

to engage with meetings how and when it works best for them. 

❓Before scheduling your next meeting, ask yourself: could this meeting be an email? 😉 Real time saver! ⏳

🟢Although some might argue that AI-generated copy is not as effective as human-written copy when it comes to creating engaging and persuasive content that truly resonates with readers

🔴But we can't ignore the fact that AI has affected copywriting by automating certain repetitive tasks, such as generating product descriptions or social media posts or articles. 

🔴This means that some entry-level copywriting jobs may be more scarce than they were in the past. 

🟢But on the bright side, AI has actually increased the demand for high-quality copywriting, as companies seek to differentiate themselves from their competitors by creating unique and compelling content by subject-matter experts. 

🟢This means experienced copywriters who can produce outstanding copy with unique perspectives and quotes from experts are still in demand and can command high salaries.🥳

🤝So AI is not a threat. You need to view it as a collaborator and an assistant to help you take your content creation to the next level!

✅𝙄𝙙𝙚𝙣𝙩𝙞𝙛𝙮 𝙮𝙤𝙪𝙧 𝙖𝙪𝙙𝙞𝙚𝙣𝙘𝙚'𝙨 𝙥𝙖𝙞𝙣 𝙥𝙤𝙞𝙣𝙩𝙨: To write effective copy that addresses your audience's pain points, you must first understand what their pain points are. Conduct thorough research and gather data to determine what challenges and frustrations your audience faces.

✅𝙐𝙨𝙚 𝙚𝙢𝙥𝙖𝙩𝙝𝙮 𝙩𝙤 𝙘𝙤𝙣𝙣𝙚𝙘𝙩 𝙬𝙞𝙩𝙝 𝙮𝙤𝙪𝙧 𝙖𝙪𝙙𝙞𝙚𝙣𝙘𝙚: Once you have identified your audience's pain points, use empathy to connect with them on a personal level. Show them that you understand their struggles and that you are here to help.

✅𝙁𝙤𝙘𝙪𝙨 𝙤𝙣 𝙗𝙚𝙣𝙚𝙛𝙞𝙩𝙨 𝙧𝙖𝙩𝙝𝙚𝙧 𝙩𝙝𝙖𝙣 𝙛𝙚𝙖𝙩𝙪𝙧𝙚𝙨: When writing copy that addresses pain points, focus on the benefits of your product or service rather than its features. Show your audience how your product or service can help solve their problems and make their lives easier.

✅𝙐𝙨𝙚 𝙨𝙩𝙤𝙧𝙮𝙩𝙚𝙡𝙡𝙞𝙣𝙜 𝙩𝙤 𝙘𝙧𝙚𝙖𝙩𝙚 𝙖𝙣 𝙚𝙢𝙤𝙩𝙞𝙤𝙣𝙖𝙡 𝙘𝙤𝙣𝙣𝙚𝙘𝙩𝙞𝙤𝙣: Use storytelling to create an emotional connection with your audience. Share stories of other customers who have used your product or service to overcome similar pain points, and show how it has transformed their lives.

✅𝙐𝙨𝙚 𝙖 𝙨𝙩𝙧𝙤𝙣𝙜 𝙘𝙖𝙡𝙡-𝙩𝙤-𝙖𝙘𝙩𝙞𝙤𝙣 (𝘾𝙏𝘼): Finally, make sure your copy includes a strong call-to-action that encourages your audience to take action. Whether it's signing up for a free trial, making a purchase, or contacting you for more information, 𝗺𝗮𝗸𝗲 𝗶𝘁 𝗰𝗹𝗲𝗮𝗿 𝘄𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝘄𝗮𝗻𝘁 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗮𝘂𝗱𝗶𝗲𝗻𝗰𝗲 𝘁𝗼 𝗱𝗼 𝗻𝗲𝘅𝘁.

𝗥𝗲𝗮𝗱𝘆 𝘁𝗼 𝘁𝗮𝗸𝗲 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗯𝗿𝗮𝗻𝗱'𝘀 𝗺𝗲𝘀𝘀𝗮𝗴𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝘁𝗼 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗻𝗲𝘅𝘁 𝗹𝗲𝘃𝗲𝗹? 𝗟𝗲𝘁'𝘀 𝘄𝗼𝗿𝗸 𝘁𝗼𝗴𝗲𝘁𝗵𝗲𝗿 𝘁𝗼 𝗰𝗿𝗲𝗮𝘁𝗲 𝗰𝗼𝗽𝘆 𝘁𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝘀𝗽𝗲𝗮𝗸𝘀 𝘁𝗼 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗮𝘂𝗱𝗶𝗲𝗻𝗰𝗲'𝘀 𝗽𝗮𝗶𝗻 𝗽𝗼𝗶𝗻𝘁𝘀 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗱𝗿𝗶𝘃𝗲𝘀 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝘃𝗲𝗿𝘀𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀. 𝗖𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗮𝗰𝘁 𝗺𝗲 𝘁𝗼𝗱𝗮𝘆 𝘁𝗼 𝗱𝗶𝘀𝗰𝘂𝘀𝘀 𝘆𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗰𝗼𝗽𝘆𝘄𝗿𝗶𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗻𝗲𝗲𝗱𝘀!

Ever heard of Professional Employer Organizations (PEOs)?

Let's see what they can do for you...

As a small business owner, it might get overwhelming for you to focus on building a thriving business while also looking after all administrative and HR functions on your own.


From recruiting to payroll management, bookkeeping, managing customer relationships, employee benefits & compensation, and the never-ending administrative tasks...


Hiring new staff and training them for the job can be cost- & time-consuming...


That’s why you should consider outsourcing the cumbersome HR tasks to trained specialists instead of handling everything on your own.


That's where PEOs come into play!


Professional employer organizations (PEOs) are HR companies that handle the HR functions and employee-related tasks of small and medium businesses (SMBs), so they can focus on their core business.

Some of the popular PEOs are:

👔 ADP  
👔 Paychex 
👔 Justworks 
👔 Rippling 
👔 Insperity 
👔 TriNet 
👔 CoAdvantage (link in comments)

Ever heard of 𝗣𝗿𝗼𝗽𝘁𝗲𝗰𝗵❓

It's a term used for Property tech – a combo of Real Estate tech (REtech), and construction tech (CONtech).


Proptech has been late to the digital party as compared to other techs like HRtech, FinTech, Martech, Edtech, HealthTech, GreenTech, BioTech, and RetailTech.


But it's been gaining popularity real quick, especially after COVID and that has put immense pressure on real estate developers to innovate to avoid getting marginalized.


Besides high energy prices, climate change, government regulations, and socio-economic factors pushing sustainability up the real estate agenda, Proptech is emerging as a game changer for the real estate industry. Airbnb leads the charts as one of the top proptech companies.

Yeah! You read that right. It's no longer about your physical & mental health only. It has real-world consequences.


According to a Neuroscience institute's research, those who were sleep-deprived showed a decreased natural instinct to help others, in addition to increased health risks like heart diseases, diabetes, hypertension, depression, etc.


Here's what the study of 'people who slept for 08 hours and those with no sleep' uncovered:


👉Lack of sleep impairs the theory of mind network; meaning the part of brain that feels "sympathy" fails to respond in sleep deprived people.


👉Sleep deprived people are likely to be disengaged & isolated and may spread this loneliness to others like a virus 


👉We are less generous when we don't sleep (charitable donations wise – study)


🌊It's like a ripple effect. Even a little bit of sleep deprivation has a measurable impact on a connected society.


♥️Please get enough sleep! Even if not for you, do it for others — your family, friends, colleagues, and broader society.

Your thoughts?💭

Link in comments.⬇️

Google major Content Update: 
𝗔𝘃𝗼𝗶𝗱 𝗖𝗿𝗲𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗖𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗻𝘁 𝗳𝗼𝗿 𝗦𝗲𝗮𝗿𝗰𝗵-𝗲𝗻𝗴𝗶𝗻𝗲𝘀; 𝗙𝗼𝗰𝘂𝘀 𝗼𝗻 𝗣𝗲𝗼𝗽𝗹𝗲-𝗳𝗶𝗿𝘀𝘁 𝗰𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗲𝗻𝘁

To ensure that people see more helpful and original content first, Google is rolling out this "helpful content update" in a couple of weeks.

⚠️ Warning for those who are ⚠️

⚠️Creating content primarily focused on attracting search engines, rather than humans

⚠️Producing lots of content on different topics in hopes that some of it might perform well in search results

⚠️Using extensive automation to produce content on many topics

⚠️Only summarizing what others have to say without adding much value

⚠️Writing about things simply because they seem to trend

⚠️Leaving the reader unsatisfied & they feel the need to search again

⚠️Writing to a particular word count (Google doesn't have one)

⚠️Deciding to enter some niche topic area without any real expertise just to get more traffic

⚠️Promising to answer a question that actually has no answer, such as suggesting there's a release date for a product, movie, or TV show when one isn't confirmed

Does this mean SEO is dead?

No. Google will rank the quality content written by people, for people, while also utilizing SEO best practices.


Still, think AI is gonna replace humans?

Here are 6 tips to manage your time effectively and boost your productivity:

1. Set goals and break them down into milestones (hourly or per day)

2. Create a daily to-do list, and stick to it

3. Prioritize your urgent-important tasks

4. Know your "Prime Time" of the day, when you're most productive and utilize it

5. Self-management; stop procrastinating, don't stress too much, get good rest, take care of your health and hold yourself accountable

6. Even if you follow all the steps and still get interrupted because of some unforseen circumstances, set an extension request procedure with the client. They'll understand.

I once asked a very successful woman to share her secret with me. 

She smiled and said to me.. 

"I started succeeding when I started leaving small fights for small fighters. 

I stopped fighting those who gossiped about me...

I stopped fighting with my in laws...

I stopped fighting for attention...

I stopped fighting to meet public expectation of me...

I stopped fighting for my rights with stupid people..

I left such fights for those who have nothing else to fight...

And I started fighting for 
my vision, 
my dreams, 
my ideas and 
my destiny. 

The day I gave up on small fights is the day I started becoming successful."

Some fights are not worth your time.
Choose what you fight for wisely.

Applied for a position. Aced the interview. Recruiter called and said I was the top contender. Then I got rejected. I later learned that they hired a relative of the CEO. I got much better job instead somewhere else.

Learned:

1. You can be the best and still not selected

2. You do not get rejected, you get redirected 

3. When you don't get selected, it is their loss, not yours 

4. Your value does not diminish because of someone's inability to see your worth

5. Believe in yourself no matter how many rejections you get.

7 Simple Things a Manager can do to Improve Employee Morale:

1. Connect with staff- Don’t just lock yourself in your office whole day, and only communicate with them when you want something done. 
2. Show employees that you genuinely care about them. Advocate for them. Don't throw them under the bus when things go wrong.
3. Practice open honest two-way Communication. Keep employees informed. Welcome feedback and take action.
4. Be Fair and neutral. Treat everyone fairly. Don’t pick favorites. Lead by example. Be known as a person of integrity.
5. Empower Employees. Provide them with the proper tools, then give them room to get the job done. DON'T Micromanage!
6. Reward and Recognition- Show employees how much you value and appreciate them and their efforts.
7. Read FULL post here: "Loyal Employees are your Most Valuable Asset!"- https://lnkd.in/e5ubfgp

Do you Agree?

Why HIRE talented people and treat them like they are inferior? I had a manager, I couldn’t send an email without her checking it first. She was more concerned about pushing her weight around than developing employees. I loved my job but I could not stand my boss. I desperately wanted to leave but couldn’t because of my college debt. * Instead of solely focusing on the bottom-line. Why not invest in the people responsible for the bottom-line?

I once interviewed this young lady highly recommended...Couldn't answer a question properly being so nervous. I knew who she worked for and this person wouldn't recommend someone unless they truly believed in them.

It was a panel interview. So I asked 2 of the panelists to leave the room and just me and the HR manager remained.  She was able to do better with the remaining questions but overall didn't do well in the interview. Still I couldn't get past my gut feeling she was the best candidate for the job. She had a good record and I was convinced to give her a try and within 6 months, she was one of my top performers.

You just never know who it is behind the person shown in an interview.
We shouldn't be too quick to cross someone off who didn't do well in the interview. The truth is interviews can be nerve-wracking. There is much more to a person that just passing / failing an interview.

Focus on the real person and what they can bring to the table. #BrigetteHyacinth

I allow my employees flexibility in lunch time, breaks, sick days, family leave, further education, etc. 

I don't believe in micromanaging.  It puts undue stress on employees.

If you hired someone, it means you believe they are capable of doing the job. Then trust them to get the job done.  You don’t need to be constantly monitoring their every movement.

The best ideas and advancements are a result of empowering your team.

Select the right people and give them room to get the job done.

באלי לספר לכם בכמה מילים על הערב צוות שהיה לי עם הצוות שלי בשבוע שעבר ועל החשיבות שלו 😍 

אתחיל דווקא מהסוף ואגיד כמה זה חשוב לפעמים לעצור את היום יום מהמשימות והעבודה הקשה, לצאת מהמשרד יחד עם הצוות ולהשקיע בזמן איכות אמיתי איתם.

למה?
קודם כל כי מגיע להם! כל אחד ואחת בצוות נותנים מעצמם מעל ומעבר ומותר וחשוב לעצור ופשוט לעשות כיף!
מעבר לזה, חשוב לי להראות לעובדים שלי את ההערכה העצומה שלי אליהם ולהגיד תודה על העבודה הקשה!!

בסוף מה אנחנו והם רוצים? לעבוד לצד אנשים שכיף לנו איתם, שהיחסים שלנו איתם טובים ונעימים וזה בדיוק מה שערב צוות טוב מייצר.

עכשיו אשמח להגיד כמה מילים על הערב עצמו.
בחרתי לעשות יחד עם הצוות סדנת אימפרוביזציה.
לא ידעתי כל כך מה יהיה ואיך יהיה, ואת כל הקסם שנוצר בערב הזה אפשר לזקוף בעיקר לזכותו של עידן שהעביר סדנא יוצאת דופן שגרמה באופן מאוד טבעי ומהיר לפתיחות לב של כל אחד ואחת מהצוות, זרימה, כיף, צחוק והתקרבות מדהימה שלנו כצוות.

כל מי שאומר.ת לעצמו.ה "זה לא בשבילי", "הצוות יותר מידי ציני בשביל זה", "הם לא יזרמו", "לא יהיה מצחיק", מפצירה בכם להזמין את עידן לסדנא כזו בעיקר, כי יש לו יכולת מופלאה לקרוא את הקבוצה ואת האנרגיה שבה בשניות ולהתאים את התוכן כך שיפתח תחושות וחוויות חדשות ומדהימות!

Last night was truly impactful! Learning about the world of VC’s, and hearing about the incredibly supportive community of women within that world was insightful and inspiring! 

Thank you to all the ladies who showed up to the event and support our initiative. 

And a special thanks again to our WIGI team, Victoria Levin, Mika Franco and Sandrine Bernstein for all the hard work and effort!

💭🤔How do YOU #solve complicated problems?🤔💭

Where does one begin❓

Last week, we were lucky enough to invite guest lecturer, Orr Yardeni, to present his topic of "How to solve complicated problems using different methods." Orr is skilled in the field of Strategic Consulting, which proved evident in his 🚀powerful🚀 presentation.

El-ly Namatinia, a second year Economics and Business student and participant in the TAMID group writes, "Our session with Or was incredibly #informative, practical, and engaging! The mini challenges he presented to us gave us a glimpse into the mind of a #consultant and the inner workings of a case study.”

We’re excited to continue to strengthen our consulting knowledge and delve into more exciting topics🙌.

 #business #economics

Financial literacy is an imperative skill that ultimately leads to independence, power and freedom. 💪🏼💰

For years, women have been held back from attaining this skill. At Women’s Investment Group Israel, we hope to end this trend.

This year, I, along with Victoria Levin  Mika Franco  and our Big Boss Sandrine Bernstein  have the privilege of leading Women’s Investment Group Israel, part of Investment Group Israel.

This week, we kicked off the year with our first event. Our guest, Sarah Jane Ross spoke on her experience in such a male-dominated industry, and the taboos that surround women and their relationship with money. She urged us to “know no fear”, and helped us acknowledge the importance of understanding what to do with our money.

Thank you to all of those who came to the first event, I hope you’re all as excited as I am for the year to come!🗓

#womenhelpingwomen #womeninfinance #womeninbusiness #financialfreedom

לפני חודש Alon Boneh  (אחד מראשי הצוותים של מחלקת מכירות) ביקר במקלט לכלבים עזובים ונחרד לראות באיזה תת תנאים וקושי רב הכלבים האלו חיים. הוא מיד פנה ל: Amir Nehemia המנכ״ל ושאל האם החברה יכולה לעזור במשהו. 
אמיר לא רק מיד אישר ואמר כן! אלא גם הפכנו את זה לנוהל של כל רבעון החברה תיתן תקציב לעזור כלכלית ופיזית לעמותה של נזקקים שתגיע דרך עובדי Connecteam  כיוזמה.
היום 30 איש הלכו להתנדב ולבנות מלונות עם הכסף שתרמנו לקניית חומרי הגלם 🤲

וואו, איזה מדהים היה בועידה ה-18 לניהול משאבי אנוש!

מאות מנהלות ומנהלים מתחום משאבי אנוש הגיעו לכנס שהתקיים ב-14.11.21 בתל אביב, וזו הייתה הזדמנות נהדרת גם עבורנו לפגוש פנים מול פנים חלק נכבד מלקוחותינו אחרי תקופה ארוכה מידי של ריחוק וכנסים וירטואליים.

שמחתי להיות בין הדוברים הראשיים בכנס ולשתף אודות החידושים השונים בתחום משאבי אנוש וכיצד הלקוחות של Connecteam מיישמים אותם לצד האתגרים השונים שרובנו מכירים ואשמח לשתף אתכם בכמה נקודות מעניינות מתוך ההרצאה שלי:

☝️79% משוק העבודה העולמי עדיין מורכב מחברות שמרבית העובדים שלהן אינם נגישים למחשב במהלך יום העבודה, ולמרביתם אין בכלל אימייל ארגוני

☝️בחברות בהן לחלק ניכר מהעובדים אין אימייל ארגוני, אין אפשרות להגיע לכלל העובדים בכל הקשור להעברת מסרים ארגוניים, תפעוליים וחברתיים

☝️מה שלא יהיה פשוט, פשוט לא יהיה: פשטות ומהירות הן הסוד להטמעה נכונה ולהגברת השימושיות, והן מלוות אותנו ב- Connecteam עם כל מוצר חדש שאנו מפתחים

☝️למידה במנות קטנות היא מפתח לחוויית למידה איכותית, מודרנית, וקלה ליישום

☝️טכנולוגיה ללא מתודולוגיה - תיכשל: הכלי הטכנולוגי הוא נלווה לתהליך, ולא להפך

☝️חווית עובד ב-2021 היא קריטית: העובדים שלכם מצפים לחוויה מדהימה מאפליקציה. כמו שקל להם להזמין אוכל או להעביר כסף באמצעות אפליקציה, כך הם מצפים שהתקשורת הארגונית באפליקציה תהיה גם היא קלה, פשוטה, עבורם ובשבילם

רוצים לצפות בהרצאה מתוך הכנס? תכינו לכם כוס קפה וקחו 15 דקות לצפייה. מבטיח שלא תתחרטו!

תרגישו חופשי לכתוב לי בתגובות או לשלוח הודעה פרטית. אשמח לענות על כל שאלה!

#Imhiring!
**Senior Social Media Manager**

About Connecteam:

Connecteam is a TLV-based startup that's on a mission to change the work experience for 80% of the world's global workforce - the deskless employees.

Our business management platform helps thousands of businesses thrive by taking away the daily hustle and complexities of managing teams, so they can have the peace of mind to grow and run their business.

We are looking for an experienced social media professional to take ownership of growing our followers and engagement across all social media outlets.

As Connecteam's Senior Social Media Manager, you will be responsible for building a comprehensive social media strategy, planning and executing branding strategy on social outlets, and create meaningful engagement with our target audience of small business owners and operators.

Responsibilities:

•	Develop and implement Connecteam's social media brand strategy across all social platforms
•	Plan and execute branding strategy in all channels especially in Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn and Tiktok
•	Create community and marketing materials
•	Explore opportunities on other social media platforms, such as Reddit, Dribbble, Pinterest, and Clubhouse
•	Respond to customer comments/messages on social outlets
•	Coordinate and Develop social best practices and strategies with other departments that utilize social accounts
•	Use a data-driven approach to inform and build an overall social strategy to increase awareness and engagement
•	Have a keen understanding of industry trends, new platforms, and best practices
•	Work with relevant stakeholders to develop and execute creative ideas, plans, and strategies

Requirements:

•	Native written English - MUST
•	3+ years of experience managing social media channels for B2B companies - MUST
•	Experience in building a social media calendar - MUST
•	Proven experience developing and implementing a successful social media strategy at scale
•	Experience in planning and executing branding strategy in all social media outlets, especially on Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, Tiktok and Pinterest.
•	Excellent interpersonal and organizational skills
•	Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines
•	Experience in SaaS - an advantage
•	Background working with SMB audiences - an advantage

Please send your cv to-
paz@connecteam.com

Introducing Shop Videos, powered by Tolstoy

Today Tolstoy is launching an official partnership with Shopify, making it ridiculously easy for brands to add shoppable videos to their Shop store – for free!

Set up is completely free & automatic, and you don’t have to be an existing Tolstoy customer to get access. To learn more and get started: https://lnkd.in/d9KNnHpV

Why I believe this new partnership is a game-changer for brands:

1. Drive sales from a new channel without any additional cost or effort. Over the past few months, hundreds of Tolstoy brands have seen massive uplifts in conversions & AOV after showcasing videos on their Shop stores.

2. Get discovered by tens of millions of Shop App users. Discovery on Shop is mostly visual, and videos play a huge role in driving new traffic to your store.

Our team can get your existing videos live on your Shop store in about 5 minutes, for free. Comment below & our team will reach out.

A big thank you to Emma Cole, Kaj Drobin, Mitchell Sidharta, Joakim K., Quique Fagoaga Figueiras, Sebastián Balay, Thomas Marshall, and the entire Shop team for being amazing partners in this process.

You rock!

Who could have anticipated that a #BIRDEnergy project to improve #energyefficiency in the hospitality industry would be mobilized to assist in the #coronavirus crisis?

The BIRD Energy project between Israel-based ZES- Zero Energy Solutions and Driftwood Hospitality Management in the U.S. will deploy smart climate automation technology to so-called "corona hotels" that have been repurposed to accommodate #COVID19 patients.

ZES's #AI-driven climate management platform will provide virus sufferers with much-improved air quality and a reduction in potentially harmful microbes and bacteria, in an effort to optimize the environmental conditions for recovery at adapted Driftwood-managed properties.

With a presence throughout the U.S. and Latin America, Driftwood is collaborating with ZES to streamline energy consumption and reduce the operating costs of thousands of rooms in dozens of their facilities - an effort that should be completed in 2020.

לא סביר…. מספר אירועים לא סבירים רק מהימים האחרונים

לא סביר שהשר לביטחון לאומני, עבריין מורשע, יוכל להטיל על כל אדם, בחתימתו בלבד (ללא בית משפט) להלן "חוק סמכויות מנהליות (מעצרים והגבלות)" הגבלות הכוללות:
1. לקיחת דרכון
2. ניתוק מהאינטרנט
3. איסור לשהות/לגור במקום מסויים
4. מעצר מנהלי

לא סביר שבחצי השנה האחרונה מאז מונה העבריין המורשע השר לביטחון לאומני, תמונת צמרת המשטרה נראית כך : 
מפקד מחוז מרכז - התפטר 
מפקד מחוז צפון - התפטר 
מפקד מחוז תל אביב - התפטר 
ראש אגף מבצעים - התפטר 
המזכיר הבטחוני לשר - התפטר 
ראש אגף תכנון - התפטר 
ראש אגף תנועה - התפטר 
ראש אגף סי"ף התפטר 
סגן המכ"ל - פרש

לא סביר שמוגי הלב,  שרי הממשלה תקפו את היועצת המשפטית לממשלה בזה אחר זה, במשך שעות, וקראו להדיח אותה מיד לאחר האישור הסופי של ביטול עילת הסבירות: "רק כך נוכיח שאנחנו באמת שולטים"


לא סביר שהשר להרס הכלכלה מר ברקת אומר אתמול : " אני רוצה יועמ"ש שמפרשן חוק כפי שאני חושב לנכון "

לא סביר שביום הולדת של שקמה ברסל עוברת קריאה ראשונה של  ביטול חוק הסבירות ( אל דאגה כאן זה יעצור ) ומזל טוב לאחת והיחידה

לא סביר שזאת שיחה שהתנהל אתמול, בין ישראל כץ לכתבת ערוץ 13 - לא סביר קיצוני
ישראל כץ: למרות ביטול עילת הסבירות בית המשפט יוכל לפסול מינויים, למשל אדם שממנה את הילד שלו. 
ליאור קינן: איך בית המשפט יוכל לפסול את המינוי? 
ישראל כץ: הוא יוכל לפסול בעילה של אי סבירות קיצונית.

לא סביר שהאישה הכי לא סבירה בחיינו, ח״כ טלי גוטליב הגיבה בשידור אתמול על אזהרת נגיד בנק ישראל שחקיקה חד צדדית פוגעת בכלכלה- ״אני אומרת לנגיד בנק ישראל, דע את מקומך. אל תביע את עמדתך בנושא שאתה לא מבין בו״

לא סביר שמפקד מחוז תל אביב אומר במילים שלא משתמעות לשתי פנים שהליצן לביטחון לאומני הורה לרוצץ גולגלות ובאותו יום מגיעים 12 איש לאיכילוב מפגיעת מכתזית בכינון ישיר

לא סביר שהשר הבזיוני שטוף השנאה מר אמסלם  יגיב לפציעתו הקשה ואיבוד ראיה בעין אחת של לוחם טייס וגיבור ישראל אודי אורי "צפונבון נשרט ליד העין שולחים אליו את ה BBC" אותו אחד גם דרש ממנכלית רשות החברות שלא תפנה אליו יותר. 
שנאה היא מחלה

לא סביר שח"כ ניסים ואטורי ( מי ???) אומר : " צריך לבעוט את הסרבנים מי שלא רוצה שילך מפה"

לא סביר שאנחנו משלמים משכורת  לח"כ פיןדרוס,  מתנגדי הרפורמה ?  " פשיסטים שצריך הרוג את כולם"  הקהילה הגאה  ? "יותר מסוכנת מחיזבאללה, חמאס ודאעש"

לא סביר שנתניהו ואנשיו אפילו הפסיקו להכחיש עוד את העובדה שהחקיקה המתועבת שלהם פוגעת בכלכלה

לא סביר שעדיין לא כולם הפנימו את עומק התרגיל, מי שיצר את הקרע הנוראי בעם שלנו ואת הפילוג הוא גורם אחד בלבד ראש הממשלה נתניהו שהחליט להעביר חוקי הפיכה מטורללים ויצא למסע נקם. ההפגנות לא קורעות את העם אלא מצילות את העם.

 
סביר שממשלת החורבן הכי לא סבירה שועטת באמוק לביטול עילת הסבירות

לא סביר שלא נקום ונלחם בכל הכוח עד שננצח

מאות מנהלות ומנהלים מתחום משאבי אנוש הגיעו לכנס שהתקיים ב-14.11.21 בתל אביב, וזו הייתה הזדמנות נהדרת גם עבורנו לפגוש פנים מול פנים חלק נכבד מלקוחותינו אחרי תקופה ארוכה מידי של ריחוק וכנסים וירטואליים.

שמחתי להיות בין הדוברים הראשיים בכנס ולשתף אודות החידושים השונים בתחום משאבי אנוש וכיצד הלקוחות של Connecteam מיישמים אותם לצד האתגרים השונים שרובנו מכירים ואשמח לשתף אתכם בכמה נקודות מעניינות מתוך ההרצאה שלי:

☝️79% משוק העבודה העולמי עדיין מורכב מחברות שמרבית העובדים שלהן אינם נגישים למחשב במהלך יום העבודה, ולמרביתם אין בכלל אימייל ארגוני

☝️בחברות בהן לחלק ניכר מהעובדים אין אימייל ארגוני, אין אפשרות להגיע לכלל העובדים בכל הקשור להעברת מסרים ארגוניים, תפעוליים וחברתיים

☝️מה שלא יהיה פשוט, פשוט לא יהיה: פשטות ומהירות הן הסוד להטמעה נכונה ולהגברת השימושיות, והן מלוות אותנו ב- Connecteam עם כל מוצר חדש שאנו מפתחים

☝️למידה במנות קטנות היא מפתח לחוויית למידה איכותית, מודרנית, וקלה ליישום

☝️טכנולוגיה ללא מתודולוגיה - תיכשל: הכלי הטכנולוגי הוא נלווה לתהליך, ולא להפך

☝️חווית עובד ב-2021 היא קריטית: העובדים שלכם מצפים לחוויה מדהימה מאפליקציה. כמו שקל להם להזמין אוכל או להעביר כסף באמצעות אפליקציה, כך הם מצפים שהתקשורת הארגונית באפליקציה תהיה גם היא קלה, פשוטה, עבורם ובשבילם

One of the coolest Dataviz, A Day in the Life of Americans.

This is a simulation of 1,000 people's average day. It's based on 2014 data from the American Time Use Survey, made way more accessible by the ATUS Extract Builder.

Each dot represents a person, color represents the activity, and time of day is shown in the top left. As someone changes an activity, say from sleep to a morning commute, the dot moves accordingly.

Following the timeline of the ATUS, the simulation starts at 4:00am and runs through 24 hours. The day starts with little movement as people are asleep and won’t wake up for a few hours. For most, the day starts at 7:00am and then it’s off to the races (which is especially fun to see on the fast speed).

Also, don't forget to signup for the Wand AI, Give it a try for free here: bit.ly/3BZmbPF

Thanks to Nathan Yau for this amazing Dataviz article.

Follow Wand for more AI and Data Science insights!

iris-yardeny-9876414b.postDetails:
🏦 Silicon Valley Bank collapse highlights the importance of an internal communications strategy, whether you're running a cafe, laundry, or bank! 

Few stats that show the importance of consistent and direct internal communications with employees: 
💵 A study by McKinsey & Company found that companies with effective communication practices had a 47% lower employee turnover rate than those with poor communication practices.
💵 A study by Dynamic Signal by Firstup found that 80% of employees who received poor communication from their employers were likely to leave their jobs within the next two years.
💵 According to a survey by Gallup, employees who receive regular communication from their managers are three times more likely to be engaged at work.
💵 A study by WTW found that organizations with effective communication practices had an engagement level of 79%, compared to just 29% for organizations with poor communication practices.

📣 On a regular basis and especially in times of uncertainty, you should have a direct communication channel between the company leadership and frontline employees

Check in the comments below How to Know if Your Internal Communication Strategy Works 👇 

#svbcollapse #silliconvalleybank #employeecommunications #internalcommunications #employeeengagement #wearemanagers

The digital wallet is finally coming to Israel. With Apple Pay expected to come to Israel in the coming weeks, Bank Hapoalim בנק הפועלים launched its new digital wallet this week, allowing customers to pay at stores by simply touching their smartphone to the checkout device.

Digital wallets like Apple Pay and Google Pay, along with digital payment solutions like PayPal and Venmo, are designed to make digital payments easier than credit card transactions.

Israelis have had apps like Bit, Pepper and Paybox that allow them to transfer money between friends for several years, but the new wave of digital wallets is expected to change the way Israelis make commercial payments.

Bank Hapoalim’s Bit is believed to be the most popular payment app, with an estimated 50% of the local market.

Over the coming week, the Android app is being upgraded to include the wallet feature, which requires a separate registration, a company representative explained.

The wallet enables purchases at stores and online without a pin number at any store in Israel or abroad that supports the NFC protocol.

Read the full article through the link in the comments below.

#fintech #banking #bankingindustry #digitalbanking #digitalwallet #applepay #bankingtechnology #financialtechnology #financialservices

yuval-magnus.postDetails:
Andrey Kozlov participated in a Masa program last year and interned at Syte, a successful company in Tel Aviv. After finishing his program, he embarked on a new chapter in his life and he was truly enjoying life in Israel.

On the morning of October 7, his life and of his dear ones changed. He was working as a security guard at the Nova Festival in Re’im, when the chaos started to unfold. Initially, he reassured his loved ones that everything was fine but unfortunately, that was the last contact they had with him.

Andrey’s story is one of the 240 heartbreaking tragedies involving innocent people who fell into the hands of Hamas and were taken to Gaza. We share Andrey’s story to shed light on his situation and to join the collective call for the safe return of him and all hostages to their homes.

#bringthemhomenow

Only six months ago Andrey was an intern on my team. 
The first moment we met I knew he had to be part of it because he’s so talented. 

He came to Israel in search for a better life and future, only a year and a half ago.

We must bring Andrey safely home - now.

We must bring them all home now.

אתמול הרציתי על שילוב אנשים עם מוגבלות בעבודה ובחברה בפני 200 אנשים בערב מורשת של עמותת חמש אצבעות.
היה מרגש לחזור להרצות אחרי יותר משנה...

פתחתי את ההרצאה בהעלאת זכרו של סג״מ ארז אורבך הי״ד, שנרצח ב- 8.1.2017. 

ארז שירת במרכז ניסויי הטיסה של חיל האוויר, ויצא לקורס קצינים. 

ב- 8.1.17 הגיע עם צוערים נוספים לטיילת ארמון הנציב, במסגרת סדרת חינוך. במהלך הביקור פנה למדריך הקבוצה, וביקש להזכיר שעליהם להספיק להגיע לכותל המערבי כדי להתפלל מנחה במניין, מאחר וצום עשרה בטבת חל באותו היום. 

זמן קצר לאחר מכן, מחבל תושב שכונת ג'אבל מוכאבר שבמזרח ירושלים, ביצע פיגוע דריסה באמצעות המשאית שלו, ורצח את סגן שיר חג'אג', סגן יעל יקותיאל, סגן משנה שירה צור וארז אורבך.

ארז נלחם להתנדב לצבא שלנו אחרי ששוחרר מסיבות רפואיות בגלל מחלה. הוא גיבור ישראל. מנהיג אמיתי. דוגמה להתגברות על מכשולים. 

ארז אמר ביום הוקרה למתנדבים לצה"ל: 
"על אף מחלתי, מעולם לא ראיתי את עצמי שונה מאחרים או בעל זכויות יתר. כשהגיע הצו הראשון לא שיערתי איזה מסע ארוך אעבור כדי להתגייס. החשש שלא אוכל להתגייס עקב מחלתי הנדירה התאמת. צה"ל החליט לפטור אותי משירות. על אף מחלתי, לא ראיתי עצמי שונה מאחרים או בעל זכויות יתר. ודאי שלא חשבתי שמגיע לי לעשות פחות מאחרים. ידעתי אז, ואני יודע גם היום שאני כמו כולם, כמעט, והחלטתי שאני לא מוותר. אחרי טפסים וטלפונים, ומעבר בין ועדות עם המתנה ארוכה, קיבלתי אישור להתנדב". 

יהי זכרו ברוך!

Is global warming a fact or fiction? 🌎

This animation displays temperature changes by country from 1880 to 2021.

Over 200 years of data is sufficient for numerous scenarios; industries often rely on less than a decade of information for predictions.

However, Earth's age exceeds 4 billion years, meaning our precise knowledge of its temperature is minuscule.

Several perspectives on these trends exist:
1- It's clear that temperatures have risen in the past two centuries.
2- This might be a normal Earth trend, potentially lasting another century before reversing.
3- Uncertainty remains whether this is a standard cycle or a continuous, destructive pattern, considering the previous ice age.

What actions should we take? How do you interpret this chart?

Animation by Antti Lipponen

#globalwarming #climatechange #dataanalysis #sustainability #earth

This is known as one of medicine’s most incredible moments. 

In 1922, at the University of Toronto, scientists went to a hospital ward with children who were comatose and dying from diabetic keto-acidosis.

 Imagine a room full of parents sitting at the bedside waiting for the inevitable death of their child. The scientists went from bed to bed and injected the children with the new purified extract - insulin. 

As they began to inject the last comatose child, the first child injected began to awaken. One by one, all of the children awoke from their diabetic comas. 

A room of death and gloom, became a place of joy and hope. Thank You Dr. Banting and Dr. Best!



 # #medicine #university #hospital #thankyou # #healthcare #doctor #medicine #medicaleducation #healthawareness #healthcareheroes #healthawareness #healthcareleadership #healthcareproviders #healthcareleaders #paediatrics #paediatric #pediatrician #pediatricians #pediatriccare #rajkhillan #linkedinconnections #linkedinglobal

The Israeli-Palestinian conflict is old news. We have been fighting over it for over 100+ years, and the debate will likely continue for the foreseeable future. Until recently, Israelis preferred avoiding the subject with our counterparts, choosing to create jobs and do business rather than walking our colleagues through 3000+ years of painstaking history only to see the Palestinians draw the victim card. 

This is not the case anymore. It is not "business as usual". The atrocities of Hamas, the kidnapping of innocents, their exploitation of social media, seeing them lying through their teeth, manipulating our pain over lost relatives and friends, stopping at nothing, and eventually owning the narrative over social and conventional media is where we draw the line. 

We are furious.  

There is no "Israeli propaganda, " just ordinary people saying, "No more." We will not tuck this away somewhere or "let it slide." We will stand for what is right. We will speak our minds and demand that justice will be done on every platform possible. 

We will not live in fear.

We wish that one day, our enemies will choose the path we chose: to create jobs rather than take lives, to choose hope over destruction, just like we did with our tiny startup nation. 

And no, we are not OK.

Why must Jews endure devastating tragedies to gain recognition from the world?

In the early 1900s, it required pogroms in Eastern Europe to compel the British government to acknowledge and support the establishment of a "national home for the Jewish people."

Later, it took the largest genocide in human history for the General UN Assembly to adopt the partition plan, granting Jews independence.
In the 70 years that followed, we endured numerous wars, attacks, and terror incidents, resulting in thousands of deaths, injuries, and traumatized soldiers and civilians.

We constantly find ourselves apologizing for our ability to build strength, resilience, and a powerful army against threats from all fronts. This is because you, the so-called developed world, failed to see through the David vs. Goliath narrative perpetuated by Hamas and other terrorist organizations. They created a distorted image of us, transforming Jews into devils walking the earth.

It has been effortless for you to get engagement on social media, turning Israel into the villain, showing snapshots of destroyed houses and wounded children as if we were this brutal nation that feeds of the blood of the dead, all the while rockets were shot on civilians targets day and night, constant threats, stabbings on the street and inner-city busses exploding. 

By presenting Israel as the source of evil on social media you have given in to cheap propaganda, based on missing facts, delivered  by ignorant influencers who wouldn’t know where Gaze is on a map. Shame. 

Like any other sovereign country, Israel is not immune to criticism based on strategic and political errors that have occurred and will occur. However, there is no proportion between fair criticism and the severe anti-Israel slander deeply rooted in anti-Semitism.

This conflict pits a liberal nation (far from being flawless), seeking economic and cultural prosperity, against a group of terrorists bent on eradicating the country and its people from the face of the earth, using any means necessary.
In October 2023, over 1,000 humans were brutally murdered, kidnapped, raped, and wounded—truly catastrophic.
But the real tragedy is that it took yet another massacre for the world to listen.

Now, with your permission, we will take whatever actions are necessary to eliminate this existential threat, just as any other country would have done long ago.
#StandwithIsrael #Israel #HamasisISIS

Before publishing this new position on our website, I wanted to share with my attorney friends that we're looking for an In-house Counsel for Connecteam!

This is a great chance to join one of the most growing startups in Israel, and the global industry leader in what we do. Plus, it's a rare opportunity to build something out of nothing, and really make a mark and an impact.

In our perspective, a good In-house Counsel is:
 
>> A business partner that manages risks and thinks what CAN be done, and not only what can’t be done

>> Someone that understands how to play nice with others, that knows how to collaborate with other colleagues from other departments, and that can speak the language that makes it easy for non-legal partners to understand and act upon

>> A responsible manager that understands when is the time to raise a red flag before damage is being done

>> A proactive person. We’re looking for counsel that will actively sync with others and establish themselves as a trusted advisor

>> We’re not looking for a counsel that just waits for others to approach them or for a task to come in

>> Someone that is the HR and Business’ best friend, that’s helping the company to work and manage things responsibly while moving forward without a “no, we can’t” attitude

Sounds awesome, right? DM me for questions or to kick off the hiring process.

For more about Connecteam, you can visit us at connecteam.com :)

eli-razimor-apter.postDetails:
A few days ago, a colleague of mine from a team that takes care of clients with a larger pool of employees than the segment I work in left on a short paternity leave, right after the birth of his lovely new son (Mazal tov).

As a short term replacement, my name was brought up to temporarily manage his clients while still keeping an eye on my own clients. When my manager asked me if I would be up for it, my natural instinct was to say no. As flattering as it was to be chosen to assist, after all, I manage clients with 11-50 employees and now I would have to temporarily manage clients with a pool of 51-200 employees, which requires a different set of tools that I didn’t get trained for and a more focused and robust type of client management.

What overcame the ‘obviously not’ instinct was the thought that leads me all throughout the past year, and that is to say ‘yes’ to every offer and opportunity that is being offered to me and to deal with the repercussions and challenges that come with it on the go. It is this ‘yes’ approach that leads to actions that help me achieve professional growth. With this example, I would get a taste of a different type of client management and work with a new set of brilliant colleagues. Each time I yes ‘yes’ and get through the the task that I originally wanted to refuse, I get reminded that the only thing that has ever limited me from succeeding anything is my fear of it. 

Once I became fully aware of this about myself and learned to grow from it, rather than stay back, I started saying ‘yes’ to more offers I got this year and became unstoppable.

I’m wishing everyone a happy Jewish new year full of sweetness, health, self-fulfillment, and many more Yeses! 🍎🍯

(The quote in the picture is from the ‘Rich Dad, Poor Dad’ - an absolute must read).

6 months at Connecteam is a big milestone for me! 🎉 

Before joining Connecteam, I was looking for a high-tech job for about a year. For a while, I felt like I wanted to enhance my career, work in English, and take my client-facing skills to the next level, both in terms of bringing value to a growing company and boosting my professional development. Endless interviews and attempts at great companies, in some of which I got very far in the hiring process, but in the end someone a bit more experienced than me got chosen over me. 

I was always being told by my close ones that "high-tech is so for you", "your English is perfect," "you are so good at working with clients," "you would be the perfect fit for any company." These kinds of comments would put more pressure on me and raise my disappointment each time I got refused a job.

But then I tried Connecteam - something about the hiring process felt so right for me, I was ready to get it, but I also remembered not to get too excited until I passed all the stages and to give my 100% at every stage separately. When I got the job, I realized that every failed attempt brought me closer to this successful one and I was ever grateful for every "no" I got from the HRs.

Today, 6 months in, I can say that I work at a company with a great product that helps small and large businesses all over the world take their employee management process to the next level and ultimately excel in running their business. On the personal and professional levels, I am constantly growing at an exponential rate and I feel like Connecteam cares not only about its customers but also about its employees. Thanks to my managers and colleagues, I know that my well-being, my personal development, and professional growth as a customer success manager are some of their top priorities!

I'm excited to learn more, give as much value as I can to my clients, and leave my personal professional touch at every stage of my growth within the company! 🤩

In the picture, you can see the amazing batch that started with me on that day! ❤️

Excited to move forward with my career!

Starting the new year with a new job as a customer success manager at Connecteam 😁

Last Thursday, I finished Israel Ministry of Foreign Affairs #VoicesOfIsrael program, initiated by deputy foreign minister Idan Roll - עידן רול... I enriched my knowledge and tools on advocating for Israel and combatting the delegitimization campaign against Israel through my own perspective and I am now ready to speak for Israel on international media outlets! ✊🏻🇮🇱

Connecteam is hiring - *SEO Specialist*
Connecteam is a TLV-based startup that’s on a mission to change the work experience for 80% of the world’s global workforce - the deskless employees. 

We're looking for a highly talented, experienced, passionate, and data-driven SEO specialist to join our growing marketing team.

About this role:
As an SEO specialist at Connecteam, you will be responsible for planning, executing, and analyzing search engine optimization activities to drive the company’s organic growth efforts.

Ownership & responsibilities:
Conduct deep-dive analysis and keyword research to support Connecteam’s organic growth.
Work closely with the SEO Team on developing and implementing organic growth and optimization strategies.
Work closely with our creative & content team on planning, executing, optimizing, and analyzing content marketing activities
Conduct technical audits and deliver technical specs to other teams in order to support technical optimization of the company website.
Working with Sales, Customer Success, R&D, Product, and other teams to achieve marketing goals.
Identify trends and constantly come up with new growth opportunities
Optimizing conversion rates via examination and implementation of CRO strategies across our website.
Stay on top of the latest SEO tools, trends, and changes.
 
Qualifications:
3+ years of SEO experience with an international SaaS company (in-house).
Experience in planning and executing content marketing strategies.
Experienced in on-page optimization to boost organic growth.
Experience with conducting technical site audits.
SEO-related knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and experience with large-scale‌ ‌data‌ ‌analysis.
Excellent analytical skills, the ability to interpret data and trends along with meticulous attention to detail.
Proficiency in web analytics and SEO tools (Semrush, Ahrefs, Screaming Frog, etc.)
A team player with excellent written and oral communication skills.
Experience using WordPress.
“Can-do” and hands-on mentality, growth mindset, adaptability, and a drive for continuous improvement
Bachelor’s degree (BA/BS) in exact science, economics, industrial engineering marketing, business, or related fields
Ability to manage deadlines and prioritize tasks in a fast-paced environment.
Fluent English.

**Senior Social Media Manager**

About Connecteam:

Connecteam is a TLV-based startup that's on a mission to change the work experience for 80% of the world's global workforce - the deskless employees.

Our business management platform helps thousands of businesses thrive by taking away the daily hustle and complexities of managing teams, so they can have the peace of mind to grow and run their business.

We are looking for an experienced social media professional to take ownership of growing our followers and engagement across all social media outlets.

As Connecteam's Senior Social Media Manager, you will be responsible for building a comprehensive social media strategy, planning and executing branding strategy on social outlets, and create meaningful engagement with our target audience of small business owners and operators.

Responsibilities:

•	Develop and implement Connecteam's social media brand strategy across all social platforms
•	Plan and execute branding strategy in all channels especially in Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn and Tiktok
•	Create community and marketing materials
•	Explore opportunities on other social media platforms, such as Reddit, Dribbble, Pinterest, and Clubhouse
•	Respond to customer comments/messages on social outlets
•	Coordinate and Develop social best practices and strategies with other departments that utilize social accounts
•	Use a data-driven approach to inform and build an overall social strategy to increase awareness and engagement
•	Have a keen understanding of industry trends, new platforms, and best practices
•	Work with relevant stakeholders to develop and execute creative ideas, plans, and strategies

Requirements:

•	Native written English - MUST
•	3+ years of experience managing social media channels for B2B companies - MUST
•	Experience in building a social media calendar - MUST
•	Proven experience developing and implementing a successful social media strategy at scale
•	Experience in planning and executing branding strategy in all social media outlets, especially on Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, Tiktok and Pinterest.
•	Excellent interpersonal and organizational skills
•	Ability to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines
•	Experience in SaaS - an advantage
•	Background working with SMB audiences - an advantage
